docs.title: Ask Viq — Your 24/7 AI Conversational Analyst for eCommerce | Vortex IQ Help Centre
Ask Viq
docs.text: Ask Viq is your 24/7 conversational AI analyst — the intelligence engine at the heart of the Vortex IQ Command Centre. Ask questions in plain English, receive data-backed answers in seconds, activate specialised agents for execution tasks, and revisit any conversation thread at any time. There are no dashboards to navigate and no reports to build manually. Just ask.

docs.title: Why a Conversational AI Analyst Changes Everything
docs.text:
The traditional eCommerce reporting stack requires you to log into one platform for traffic data, another for ad performance, a third for revenue trends — and then manually reconcile all three before you can even form an opinion. By the time the picture is clear, the moment for action has passed.

Ask Viq eliminates this cycle. It connects to every data source you have linked in your workspace and answers questions across all of them in a single, natural-language conversation. The business impact of this shift is measurable: merchants who engage with conversational AI interfaces experience conversion rates 4x higher than those relying on traditional self-service tools, and customers who interact with AI-driven chat complete their tasks 47% faster (Source: HelloRep.ai — The Future of AI in eCommerce 2025).

At the organisation level, the gains compound. Companies deploying conversational AI report a 94% boost in team productivity, a 92% improvement in issue resolution speed, and a 65% reduction in operational costs (Source: IBM Research via Master of Code — State of Conversational AI 2026). For eCommerce operators, this translates directly to faster decisions, fewer missed signals, and more time spent on strategy rather than status checking.

AI-powered, context-aware intelligence — the same capability that powers Ask Viq's responses — can increase revenue by up to 41% for merchants who apply it consistently (Source: Envive.ai — AI Personalization in eCommerce Lift Statistics 2026).

docs.title: What Ask Viq Can Do
docs.text: Ask Viq handles three distinct types of work within a single conversation:

docs.title: Data Retrieval
docs.text: Pull any metric from your connected platforms without switching to a separate dashboard: - "How did revenue perform last week compared to the same period last month?" - "Which products have the lowest conversion rate in the last 30 days?" - "What is my current return on ad spend across Google and Facebook?"

docs.title: Creative Execution
docs.text: Draft outreach, content, and communications using your live store data as context: - "Draft a re-engagement email for customers who have not purchased in 60 days." - "Write product descriptions for the five items with the highest return rate." - "Suggest three promotional angles based on our best-selling categories this season."

docs.title: Agent Activation
docs.text: When your request requires specialised expertise — SEO optimisation, image compression, ad analysis — Ask Viq surfaces the relevant agent directly in the chat thread and offers to activate it with a single click. You do not need to navigate to the Agent Hub separately.

docs.title: Step 1: Access the Ask Viq Workspace
docs.text:
Click Ask Viq in the left-hand navigation sidebar from any page in the Command Centre. On your first visit — or at the start of a fresh session — you arrive at the Ask Viq welcome screen, organised into three areas:

  • Left panel: AI Agent Library — browse and activate specialised agents by category.
  • Centre: Conversation workspace — your main chat area, with guided question categories to help you explore the platform.
  • Right panel: Session tools — access Viq Persona, Quick Prompts, and Chat History.

The centre panel displays four guided question categories to help new users orient quickly: - Understanding the Basics — What is Vortex IQ? How does it differ from the tools I already use? - Features & Capabilities — What platforms does it connect to? Can it help with SEO and analytics? - For Your Business — Who is this for? How does it increase revenue or cut costs? - Getting Started — How long does setup take? What does the free plan include?

The Ask Viq welcome screen: the AI Agent Library panel (left), four guided capability categories in the main workspace (centre), and the session tools panel with Viq Persona, Quick Prompts, and Chat History tabs (right).

docs.title: Step 2: Start a Conversation
docs.text:
Type any question in the "Ask VIQ anything…" input field at the bottom of the workspace and press Enter. Ask Viq understands natural language — no special commands, no fixed query syntax required.

Once a conversation begins, the workspace transforms into a full chat interface. Your messages appear on the right; Ask Viq's responses appear on the left, clearly labelled with the Ask Viq® identity. Each conversation is assigned a unique session identifier, making it easy to locate and reload the thread later from Chat History.

The active Ask Viq chat interface: the Ask Viq® branded workspace with a live conversation thread, user and AI message bubbles clearly distinguished, and the persistent "Ask VIQ anything…" input field at the bottom.

docs.title: Step 3: Work with Specialised Agents
docs.text:
When your request requires a dedicated AI specialist, Ask Viq automatically identifies the most relevant agent and surfaces it as a card in the conversation thread. Each agent is purpose-built for a specific domain and platform. Activating it requires a single click — you never need to leave the chat.

Product Optimisation Agents — Optimise listings, page content, and imagery across your connected storefronts:

Ask Viq activating the Page Content SEO and GEO agent for Shopify — the agent card appears in the conversation thread with optimisation task results delivered inline.

The Product SEO and GEO agent for BigCommerce, delivering structured recommendations directly within the Ask Viq conversation.

The Product Image Optimisation agent for Shopify — compressing and optimising product images to improve page load speed and Core Web Vitals performance, delivered inline in the conversation.

Website Performance Agents — Diagnose and analyse site health directly in the conversation:

The Google Ads Performance agent in action within Ask Viq — delivering campaign-level analysis and spend efficiency insights without leaving the chat interface.

Google Analytics Insights delivered inline in the Ask Viq conversation — traffic trends, audience behaviour, and goal completion data without switching to a separate analytics platform.

The Core Web Vitals agent surfaces Largest Contentful Paint, Cumulative Layout Shift, and Interaction to Next Paint scores directly in the conversation, paired with actionable improvement recommendations.

Campaign & Marketing Agents:

The Dotdigital Campaign Manager agent running within Ask Viq — delivering email campaign performance data and suggested next actions in a single, continuous thread.

The Image Compression agent activated via Ask Viq — processing and optimising store imagery to reduce page weight and improve loading performance.

docs.title: Step 4: Browse and Reload Chat History
docs.text:
Every conversation with Ask Viq is automatically saved. To return to a previous session:

  1. Click the Chat History tab in the right panel.
  2. Browse your previous threads — each is displayed with a timestamp and a preview of the opening message.
  3. Click any thread to reload the full conversation and continue exactly where you left off.

Chat History persists across sessions and devices. You can reload a conversation that began days ago and resume the analysis without any loss of context.

docs.title: Step 5: Use Quick Prompts
docs.text: The Quick Prompts tab in the right panel contains a curated library of one-click prompt starters for the most common eCommerce analysis tasks. Click any prompt to pre-fill the input field, then send it immediately or customise it first. Quick Prompts reduce the time from "I have a question" to "I have an answer" for your most frequent queries.

docs.text:

docs.title: AI Safety & Guardrails
docs.text:
Every response from Ask Viq and every agent it activates operates within Vortex IQ's AI Guardrails framework — the same governance layer that applies across the entire platform.

Human-in-the-Loop Approval: When Ask Viq or an activated agent proposes a high-impact action — such as publishing updated product content, adjusting a campaign budget, or triggering a bulk operation — an approval card appears in the conversation thread. The card shows exactly what the agent intends to do, the data used to reach that recommendation, and the expected outcome. You approve or decline with a single click. No action executes automatically.

Read-Only by Default: All platform connections use read-only access as a default. Ask Viq can retrieve, analyse, and present any data from your connected sources without modifying anything. Write-level actions — publishing content, updating listings, adjusting settings — only proceed after explicit approval from a user with Manager or Administrator privileges.

Audit Trail: Every approved action, declined recommendation, and agent activation within Ask Viq is logged automatically in your Audit Trail. This creates a complete, searchable record of every decision made through the conversational interface.

Persona Configuration: The Viq Persona tab in the right panel allows Administrators to view and update the active AI persona — including the communication style, response focus, and any brand-specific guardrails applied to this workspace session.

Role-Based Access

Administrators and Managers can approve agent actions directly from within Ask Viq. Users with the Viewer role can interact with Ask Viq and read insights, but cannot approve or trigger high-impact actions.

docs.title: Ask Viq at a Glance
docs.text: Capability What It Delivers Natural Language Queries Ask any business question in plain English — no query syntax required Multi-Platform Data Answers draw from all connected sources simultaneously Agent Activation Specialised agents surface and activate directly within the conversation thread Conversation History Full thread history saved, searchable, and reloadable across any device Quick Prompts One-click starters for the most common eCommerce analysis tasks Viq Persona Configurable AI persona for brand-aligned communication style Human-in-the-Loop All write-level actions require explicit approval before execution Audit Trail Every action and recommendation logged with full accountability

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Q: Does Ask Viq require any special syntax or commands? No. Ask Viq understands natural language — type your question exactly as you would ask a colleague. There is no query language, no commands, and no structured input format required. The more context you include in your question, the more precise the answer.

Q: Can Ask Viq access data from multiple connected platforms in the same response? Yes. Ask Viq draws on all your connected data sources simultaneously. If your question involves both Google Ads performance and Shopify revenue, Ask Viq correlates the data across both sources and delivers a unified answer without requiring you to switch platforms.

Q: How long is Chat History retained? Chat History is retained for the lifetime of your workspace. Every conversation is stored and searchable from the Chat History tab in the right panel. You can reload any previous session and continue the conversation from the exact point where it left off.

Q: What happens when Ask Viq activates a specialised agent? When a specialised agent is activated, it appears as an embedded card in the conversation thread. The agent performs its analysis or task and delivers results inline — you see the full output without leaving the chat. If the agent proposes changes to your live store, an approval card appears and requires your explicit confirmation before anything is published or modified.

Q: Is Ask Viq available on mobile devices? Yes. The entire Vortex IQ Command Centre, including Ask Viq, is accessible from any modern web browser on desktop, tablet, or mobile. For managing agent outputs and reviewing detailed analysis, a desktop or laptop screen provides the best experience.

docs.title: The Command Centre — Your Single Pane of Glass for eCommerce Operations | Vortex IQ Help Centre
The Command Centre
docs.text: The Command Centre is the heart of the Vortex IQ AI OS — your single pane of glass for every metric, agent, and insight that matters to your business. It consolidates your store health, marketing performance, and AI agent activity into one intelligent interface, eliminating the need to switch between dozens of disconnected browser tabs.

docs.title: Why a Single Pane of Glass Changes Everything
docs.text:
The average digital worker toggles between applications and websites nearly 1,200 times per day, losing up to 40% of their productivity due to constant context switching (Source: Harvard Business Review; American Psychological Association — Context Switching Research). For eCommerce operators managing a Shopify store, Google Analytics, ad platforms, email tools, and inventory systems simultaneously, this fragmentation is even more acute — and the cost is measured in missed signals, delayed responses, and lost revenue.

The Command Centre was engineered to end this. Instead of logging into seven different platforms to understand your business, you arrive in a single workspace where Vortex IQ has already assembled the picture. Brands using unified commerce solutions report 36% higher checkout conversion and 22% lower total cost of ownership compared to multi-vendor stacks requiring constant integration work (Source: Shopify — Unified Commerce Software Guide 2025). And merchants using the Command Centre report a 50% reduction in the time spent on daily operational reviews — time redirected towards strategy, not status checking.

The shift to unified intelligence isn't a future trend. It is the operating model of the highest-performing eCommerce teams today.

docs.title: The Three Zones of Your Command Centre
docs.text: The Command Centre interface is organised into three purposeful areas that work together to give you situational awareness and the ability to act:

docs.title: Zone 1: The AI Agent Library (Left Panel)
docs.text: The left panel is your AI Agent Library — the catalogue of every specialised agent available for your store. Agents are grouped by capability: Product Optimisation, Website Performance, Campaign Management, and more. Browse the library to discover which agents are active, which are ready to activate, and which tasks are being handled autonomously on your behalf right now.

docs.title: Zone 2: The Command Centre Workspace (Centre)
docs.text:
The main workspace opens with the Ask Viq conversational interface — your 24/7 AI analyst, ready to answer questions, retrieve insights, or hand off to a specialised agent. On first load, you see the "Welcome to your Command Centre" screen with four guided question categories to help you explore the platform:

  • Understanding the Basics — What is Vortex IQ? How does an AI OS differ from the tools I already use?
  • Features & Capabilities — What platforms does it connect to? Can it help with SEO and analytics?
  • For Your Business — Who is this for? How does it increase revenue or cut costs?
  • Getting Started — How long to set up? What does the free plan include?

Once a conversation begins, this area transforms into a full chat interface with message history, agent hand-offs, and results delivered directly in the thread.

docs.title: Zone 3: Settings & History (Right Panel)
docs.text:
The right panel provides three contextual tools accessible from within any session:

  • Viq Persona — View and update the active AI persona configuration for this workspace session.
  • Quick Prompts — A curated library of one-click prompt starters to accelerate common tasks.
  • Chat History — Browse and reload previous conversation threads without losing context.

The Command Centre: the AI Agent Library panel (left), the main Ask Viq workspace with guided question categories including "Understanding the Basics", "Features & Capabilities", "For Your Business", and "Getting Started" (centre), and the Settings & History panel (right).

docs.title: Outcome & Impact: What the Command Centre Delivers
docs.text:
Beyond consolidating information, the Command Centre changes the operational rhythm of your entire team. Rather than reactive firefighting — discovering problems only after customers report them — you operate from a position of real-time awareness.

For operators: The Nerve Centre's Signal Alerts surface in the Command Centre the moment an anomaly is detected — a traffic drop, a checkout error, a payment gateway timeout — allowing you to respond in minutes rather than hours. eCommerce businesses adopting AI-powered automation and unified dashboards report a 45% improvement in ROI and an 80% increase in lead generation efficiency compared to those using fragmented point tools (Source: Envive.ai — AI Personalization in eCommerce Statistics 2026).

For teams: The role-based Command Centre means every team member sees the data relevant to their responsibilities without overwhelming them with irrelevant metrics. Administrators see the full picture; Managers see agent activity and approval queues; Viewers see performance dashboards. Retailers that have fully embedded AI into their customer journey are reporting 15 to 25% revenue increases — and this starts with giving each team member a clear, relevant view of the business (Source: McKinsey & Company — The Value of Getting Personalisation Right).

docs.title: Step 1: Understanding the Sidebar
docs.text:
The left-hand sidebar is the navigation spine of your entire AI Operating System. It is always visible and organises every capability into a logical hierarchy:

Primary Navigation (top): - Ask Viq — Your conversational AI for data retrieval, analysis, and task delegation. - Vortex Mind — Strategic insights, generated reports, and scheduled intelligence briefings. - Nerve Centre — Real-time monitoring dashboards for every connected platform. - Vortex Apps — Access to StagingPro (BigCommerce) and Vortex Backup tools. - Agent Hub — Your digital workforce management portal — hire, monitor, and manage AI agents.

Secondary Navigation (bottom): - Vortex Memory — Knowledge management centre where you store brand guidelines and policies. - Get Support — Direct access to help documentation and the Vortex IQ support team. - Settings — Platform configuration, connected sources, user management, and AI Guardrails. - Log Out — Secure session termination.

The active Command Centre chat interface: the Ask Viq® conversational workspace with the "Ask VIQ anything…" input field, AI and user message bubbles, and the full left-hand sidebar navigation visible — Ask Viq, Vortex Mind, Nerve Centre, Vortex Apps, Agent Hub (top) and Vortex Memory, Get Support, Settings, Log Out (bottom).

docs.title: Step 2: Starting a Conversation with Ask Viq
docs.text:
From any page in the Command Centre, you can open a conversation with Ask Viq. Simply type in the "Ask VIQ anything…" input field at the bottom of the workspace and press Enter.

Ask Viq understands natural language — no special syntax, no commands. For example:

  • "How did our revenue perform last week compared to the week before?"
  • "What's causing the drop in conversion rate I'm seeing today?"
  • "Show me which products are running low on inventory."
  • "Draft a re-engagement email for customers who haven't purchased in 60 days."

If your question requires a specialised agent — such as the Product SEO Agent or the Google Ads Performance Agent — Ask Viq will surface the relevant agent card directly in the chat thread and offer to activate it with a single click.

docs.title: Step 3: Launching Vortex Apps
docs.text:
The Vortex Apps section of the sidebar provides access to enterprise-grade tools including StagingPro for BigCommerce and Vortex Backup. App access is determined by your subscription plan — apps included in your plan are available immediately; apps not on your current plan display an upgrade prompt.

The Vortex Apps home screen, showing the suite of enterprise tools available within your workspace. App availability is determined by your subscription plan.

docs.title: Step 4: Checking Your Usage at a Glance
docs.text:
The Command Centre surfaces your workspace usage metrics so you can see at a glance how much of your plan capacity is in use. Usage indicators include:

  • Active Agents — How many AI agents are currently deployed versus your plan's agent limit.
  • Connected Integrations — How many platform connections are active versus your allowance.
  • Team Members — How many users are active in your workspace versus your plan's user limit.

If you are approaching a limit, the Command Centre surfaces an inline upgrade prompt so you can expand your capacity without interrupting your workflow.

docs.title: AI Safety & Guardrails: Control from Every Screen
docs.text:
The Command Centre is designed around one principle: you are always in control. Every AI action that could affect your live store or team requires your explicit approval before it executes — regardless of which interface you use to access it.

Human-in-the-Loop by Design: When Ask Viq or any deployed agent proposes a high-impact action — such as updating product descriptions, adjusting pricing rules, or triggering a bulk content task — an approval card appears in the Command Centre workspace. The card shows exactly what the agent intends to do, why it recommends the action, and what the expected outcome is. You approve or decline with a single click.

Audit Trail Integration: Every action surfaced through the Command Centre — approvals, rejections, agent activations, conversation summaries — is logged automatically in your Audit Trail. This creates a complete, searchable history of every decision made by your team and your AI workforce.

Subscription-Gated Access: App access, agent limits, and integration allowances are enforced in real time based on your active subscription plan. This means team members can only access the capabilities their role and plan permit — no accidental overreach, no unexpected charges.

Role-Based Visibility

What you see in the Command Centre depends on your access role. Administrators see all dashboards, approval queues, and settings. Managers see agent activity and can approve actions. Users (Viewers) can navigate the workspace and read insights but cannot approve actions or modify agent configuration.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Q: What is the Command Centre and how is it different from a regular analytics dashboard? The Command Centre is not a passive reporting tool — it is an active, AI-powered workspace. Unlike traditional dashboards that display historical data you must interpret manually, the Command Centre surfaces real-time alerts, AI-generated recommendations, and a conversational interface that lets you ask questions and take action in the same place. It is the difference between reading a report and having a senior analyst at your side at all times.

Q: Can I access the Command Centre on mobile devices? Yes. The Vortex IQ Command Centre is a fully responsive web application, accessible from any modern browser on desktop, tablet, or mobile. For the best experience managing agents and reviewing detailed reports, a desktop or laptop screen is recommended.

Q: Why do some Vortex Apps show an upgrade prompt? App access is gated by your subscription plan. Apps shown with an upgrade prompt are not included in your current plan. Click the upgrade prompt to see the plan that includes that app, or contact the Vortex IQ support team to discuss options for your workspace.

Q: Does the Chat History persist between sessions? Yes. Every conversation with Ask Viq is saved to your Chat History. You can reload any previous thread from the right panel's Chat History tab, allowing you to continue a previous analysis or share context with a team member.

Q: How does the AI Agent Library differ from the Agent Hub? The AI Agent Library in the Command Centre's left panel shows a curated catalogue of agents available for quick activation — optimised for discovery. The Agent Hub (accessible from the sidebar) is the full management portal where you configure active agents, set Guardrails, review performance metrics, and manage your complete digital workforce.

docs.title: Connecting Data Sources & Configuring Your Workspace | Vortex IQ Help Centre
Connecting Data Sources & Configuring Your Workspace
docs.text: Vortex IQ becomes your AI Operating System the moment you connect your first data source. This guide walks you through linking your eCommerce store, marketing platforms, and team settings — all secured with industry-standard authorisation and encrypted credential storage. No technical knowledge required.

docs.title: Why Your Connections Are the Foundation of Everything
docs.text:
Your AI agents are only as powerful as the data they can see. When you connect Shopify, Google Analytics, and your advertising platforms, the entire Vortex IQ OS gains a real-time, unified picture of your business — enabling the Nerve Centre to detect revenue anomalies before they cost you sales, Ask Viq to answer performance questions in plain English, and Vortex Mind to surface strategic opportunities you would otherwise miss.

The impact of this unification is measurable and immediate. Merchants using unified AI data platforms report an 80% improvement in lead generation efficiency and a 45% improvement in marketing ROI compared to those managing fragmented point tools separately (Source: AI Automation in eCommerce: 2025 ROI Guide). Beyond marketing, 72% of eCommerce businesses that adopt unified AI platforms report measurable cost reductions within the first year (Source: EComposer — AI in eCommerce Statistics 2025). And companies that excel at data-driven personalisation through unified AI platforms generate 40% more revenue than industry averages (Source: McKinsey & Company).

Connecting your sources in the first session is the single highest-leverage action you can take on the platform.

docs.title: Supported Platforms & Connection Methods
docs.text:
Connector Type Supported Platforms Connection Method Access Level eCommerce Storefronts Shopify, BigCommerce, Adobe Commerce OAuth 2.0 / API Token Read-only store data Analytics Google Analytics (GA4) OAuth 2.0 Analytics read access Paid Media Google Ads, Facebook Ads API Token Campaign read access Communications Slack, Microsoft Teams, Email Secure Webhook Inbound notifications only Payments Stripe, PayPal API Token Transaction read access Monitoring Datadog, New Relic, Cybersource API Token Metrics read access Marketing Platforms Dotdigital API Token Campaign read access

Read-Only by Default

All platform connections use the minimum permissions necessary. Vortex IQ requests read-only access to your store and analytics data as a default. Write-level access — for example, allowing an AI agent to publish a product update — requires your explicit approval each time the action is proposed. No agent can make changes to your live store without your sign-off.

To view and manage all your connected sources, navigate to Settings → Connected Sources.

The Connected Sources settings page, showing the full grid of available integrations grouped by category — Ecommerce, Analytics, Marketing, Finance, Communications, and Monitoring — with status indicators and connection controls for each.

docs.title: Connecting Shopify
docs.text:
Shopify connects via OAuth 2.0 — the same secure authorisation flow used by Shopify's own partner apps. You do not need to copy or paste any API keys manually.

  1. Go to Settings → Connected Sources and click "Add Integration".
  2. Select Shopify from the platform list.
  3. Choose your environment: Production (live store) or Sandbox (development/staging store).
  4. Enter your Shopify store name (the subdomain only — for example, enter my-store, not my-store.myshopify.com).
  5. Click "Connect to Shopify" — you will be redirected to Shopify to review and authorise the connection.
  6. Review the requested permissions and click "Install".
  7. You are returned to Vortex IQ. Your store appears as Connected within seconds and data synchronisation begins immediately.

What Permissions Does Vortex IQ Request?

Vortex IQ requests read access to products, orders, customers, and analytics. No write permissions are requested by default. Individual AI agents — such as the Product SEO Agent — may request additional scopes when you activate them. You will always be shown exactly what access is being requested before you approve.

docs.title: Connecting BigCommerce
docs.text:
BigCommerce uses a secure API token connection. You will generate a read-only token in your BigCommerce control panel and paste it directly into Vortex IQ.

  1. In your BigCommerce Admin, navigate to Settings → Store-level API Accounts.
  2. Create a new API Account with Read-Only permissions for: Products, Orders, Customers, and Analytics.
  3. Copy your Store Hash and API Access Token from the generated credentials.
  4. In Vortex IQ, go to Settings → Connected Sources → Add Integration → BigCommerce.
  5. Enter your Store Hash, paste your Access Token, and give this integration a name.
  6. Click "Verify & Connect" — Vortex IQ validates the connection in real time and confirms success.

Protect Your API Token

Your BigCommerce API token is encrypted before it is stored and is never displayed in plain text after saving. If you suspect a token has been compromised, revoke it immediately in your BigCommerce admin panel and reconnect with a fresh token from Vortex IQ.

docs.title: Connecting Google Analytics (GA4)
docs.text:
Google Analytics connects via OAuth 2.0 — no manual API credentials are required.

  1. In Vortex IQ, go to Settings → Connected Sources → Add Integration → Google Analytics.
  2. Click "Connect with Google" — you will be redirected to Google to sign in and authorise read access.
  3. Select the GA4 property you want to connect from your Google account.
  4. Approve read-only analytics access and you are returned to Vortex IQ automatically.
  5. Your GA4 data begins synchronising immediately. Initial population of historical data can take up to 24 hours.

docs.title: Connecting Facebook Ads
docs.text:
Facebook Ads connects using a manually generated system access token from your Facebook Business Manager.

  1. In Facebook Business Manager, navigate to Business Settings → System Users → Generate Token.
  2. Select Ads Read as the required permission scope and copy the generated token.
  3. In Vortex IQ, go to Settings → Connected Sources → Add Integration → Facebook Ads.
  4. Paste your system access token and enter your Ad Account ID(s) (comma-separated if you manage multiple accounts).
  5. Click "Verify & Connect".

docs.title: Connecting Adobe Commerce (Magento)
docs.text:
Adobe Commerce supports API token-based connections. Given the variety of hosting configurations, Adobe Commerce setup may require an additional step to configure your store's REST access.

  1. In Vortex IQ, go to Settings → Connected Sources → Add Integration → Adobe Commerce.
  2. Follow the on-screen instructions to generate a read-only integration token in your Adobe Commerce admin panel.
  3. Enter your store base URL and paste the generated access token.
  4. Click "Verify & Connect".

Need Help with Adobe Commerce?

Adobe Commerce configurations can vary depending on your hosting environment. If you need assistance, contact the Vortex IQ support team — we will guide you through the connection process at no additional cost.

The Account Information → Account Details page, where you can update your organisation name, website, contact details (phone, address, city, country), and primary contact information.

To update your organisation profile, navigate to Settings → Account Information.

docs.text:

Administrator Access Required

Only users with Administrator privileges can invite new team members. If you do not see the "Add User" button, contact your workspace Administrator to request access.

The Users list under Settings → Account Information, showing all team members with their assigned roles, status indicators (Active, Pending, Invited Expired), and action controls. Agency stats showing total users and partnership tier are displayed at the top.

  2. Click the "Add User" button.

The Add New User form, where you enter the team member's email address, assign their access role, and send the invitation.

Access is revoked immediately — the user cannot sign in or view any workspace data from that moment forward.

docs.title: Partner Accounts: Managing Multiple Client Workspaces
docs.text:
If you are on a Partner Account — for agencies and system integrators — you have access to a multi-merchant workspace switcher that lets you manage all your client workspaces from one login.

The multi-merchant workspace switcher available on Partner Accounts, showing a dropdown list of client workspaces with one-click switching — each workspace is fully isolated with its own data, agents, and settings.

Each client workspace is completely isolated. Their store data, agents, reports, and settings are never visible to other clients, even if they share the same Partner Account. Switching workspaces takes one click from the workspace dropdown in the top navigation.

docs.title: AI Safety & Guardrails: How Your Connected Data Is Protected
docs.text:
Every integration you create in Vortex IQ operates within a layered security framework designed to protect your business data and your customers' privacy simultaneously.

Encrypted Credential Storage: Your platform access tokens and OAuth refresh tokens are encrypted before being saved. They are never displayed in plain text after the initial connection, and they are never shared with third parties.

Minimal Permission Scopes: Vortex IQ requests only the access scopes it requires for each specific operation. All core connections use read-only access. When an AI agent needs write-level access to execute a specific task — such as updating a product description — you will be prompted for explicit approval. The action does not proceed automatically.

Human-in-the-Loop Approval: Every proposed action that touches your live store data requires manual review and approval from a user with Manager or Administrator privileges. This "Human in the Loop" design means the AI works for you — it never acts unilaterally on high-impact operations.

Audit Trail Logging: Every connection event — added, updated, disconnected — is logged in your Audit Trail with a full timestamp and the identity of the user who made the change. This gives you complete accountability over your workspace configuration at all times.

Session Security: All authentication sessions are managed via Google Cloud Identity — one of the most widely audited enterprise identity platforms available. Sessions expire automatically and are re-validated on each login to prevent unauthorised access.

GDPR & CCPA Compliance

Vortex IQ processes business performance signals — it does not store your customers' Personally Identifiable Information (PII). All data processing is performed in compliance with GDPR and CCPA requirements.

docs.title: Troubleshooting Connected Sources
docs.text:
"Connection failed" when linking Shopify: - Confirm your store name does not include https:// or .myshopify.com — enter only the subdomain (e.g., my-store). - Ensure you are logged into the correct Shopify account before authorising the connection. - Verify that your Shopify plan supports third-party app integrations.

"Invalid credentials" for BigCommerce: - Re-generate your API token in BigCommerce and ensure it has the required read-only scopes for Products, Orders, Customers, and Analytics. - Copy the full Access Token carefully — avoid including any leading or trailing spaces.

Google Analytics connected but no data appears: - Confirm you selected the correct GA4 property during the authorisation flow. - GA4 data can take up to 24 hours to appear after the initial connection.

Data stops refreshing for any platform: - Navigate to Settings → Connected Sources and check the status indicator next to the affected integration. - Click "Refresh Connection" to force a new data synchronisation. - If the status shows "Error", disconnect the integration and reconnect to re-authorise with fresh credentials.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Q: Can I connect more than one store of the same platform type? Yes. You can connect multiple Shopify or BigCommerce stores as separate integrations. Each integration is named independently and appears as its own data source in the Nerve Centre and Command Centre, with no cross-contamination between accounts.

Q: Will connecting my store affect its loading speed or checkout performance? No. Vortex IQ uses read-only, scheduled data pulls to retrieve store information. These calls are rate-limited and staggered to ensure there is no impact on your store's real-time performance or customer checkout experience.

Q: How do I disconnect a platform? Navigate to Settings → Connected Sources, locate the integration, and click "Disconnect". All data previously pulled from that source is retained in Vortex IQ for 30 days but stops refreshing immediately. After 30 days, the disconnected source's data is removed from your dashboards.

Q: Does Vortex IQ support Adobe Commerce (Magento)? Yes. Adobe Commerce is a fully supported storefront connector. The setup process requires generating a read-only integration token in your Adobe Commerce admin. Contact the Vortex IQ support team if you need assistance during configuration.

Q: What happens if my OAuth token expires? OAuth access tokens are refreshed automatically in the background whenever possible. If a token expires and cannot be silently renewed — for example, if you revoked Vortex IQ's access from Shopify's app settings — your integration will display a "Reconnect Required" status. Simply click the reconnect button to re-authorise with a single click.

docs.title: Getting Started with Vortex IQ — The World's First AI Agentic OS for eCommerce | Vortex IQ Help Centre
Getting Started with Vortex IQ
docs.text: Vortex IQ is the world's first AI Agentic Operating System (AI OS) built exclusively for eCommerce. In a single workspace, it unifies your store data, monitors revenue in real time, and deploys a digital workforce of AI agents — all without requiring any technical setup. You can be fully operational in under five minutes.

docs.title: Why an "Operating System" Replaces Your Disjointed Tools
docs.text:
The modern eCommerce stack is a patchwork of disconnected tools — one for SEO, another for inventory, a third for analytics, and a fourth for advertising. The result is data silos, missed signals, and hours lost each week manually reconciling reports across platforms that were never built to work together.

Vortex IQ was built to replace that fragmentation with a single, intelligent Command Centre. The shift is already happening at scale: 77% of eCommerce professionals now use AI daily, and 92% of companies investing in AI eventually see positive ROI, with an average payback period of just 9 months (Source: EComposer — AI in eCommerce Statistics 2025; Envive.ai — AI Personalization Statistics 2026). AI-powered recommendations alone can triple revenue and more than double conversion rates compared to unaided browsing — and businesses that excel at AI-driven personalisation generate 40% more revenue than those using fragmented tools (Source: McKinsey & Company).

Vortex IQ is how you access that advantage — from day one, without a single line of code.

docs.title: The "First 5 Minutes" Checklist
docs.text:
Onboarding is designed to require zero technical knowledge and zero code. Follow these steps to activate your AI Command Centre:

  1. Create your workspace — Sign up with Google, use a Magic Link, or register with email and password.
  2. Choose your account type — Merchant (single brand) or Partner (agency managing multiple clients).
  3. Tell us your interests — Select the areas that matter most: SEO, monitoring, analytics, or automation.
  4. Connect your store — Link Shopify, BigCommerce, or Adobe Commerce in one click.
  5. Activate your first Agent — Hire a Monitoring or Insights agent to begin receiving real-time alerts.

Your 30-Day Free Trial Starts on Day One

Every new account includes a full-featured 30-day trial — no credit card required upfront. All capabilities, including Agent Hub and Nerve Centre alerting, are available immediately from your first login.

docs.title: Step 1: Choose Your Account Type
docs.text:
When you first visit Vortex IQ, you will be asked to select your account type. This choice configures your workspace and determines which multi-client features are available to you.

The Create Account screen showing the Merchant and Partner account type toggle, the "Sign up with Google" SSO option, registration fields, and the "Get Magic Link" passwordless option — along with three left-panel value propositions: Orchestrate Your Ecosystem, From Insight to Action, and Deploy Specialised Agents.

Account Type Who It's For Merchant Brand owners, eCommerce managers, and in-house teams managing a single store or brand. Partner Agencies, system integrators, and technology partners managing multiple client accounts from one workspace.

docs.title: Step 2: Sign Up Securely
docs.text:
Vortex IQ provides three sign-up options — all delivering enterprise-grade identity protection from the moment your account is created:

Option A: Sign up with Google (Recommended) Click "Sign up with Google" to use your existing work credentials. This is the fastest path, activating automatic identity verification and secure access instantly through Google's enterprise identity infrastructure.

Option B: Get Magic Link (Passwordless) Enter your professional email and click "Get Magic Link". A one-time secure link is sent to your inbox. Click it to sign in — no password is ever set or stored.

Option C: Email & Password Enter your full name, company name, and professional email. Choose a secure password (minimum 8 characters). Your workspace is created immediately — no approval queue, no waiting period.

The Login screen showing all sign-in options: "Continue with Google", email and password form, "Continue with Email", and the "Send Password Reset Link" recovery option.

Password Reset

docs.title: Step 3: Register Your Organisation
docs.text:
After signing in for the first time, you will complete your organisation profile. This information powers how Vortex IQ labels your reports, sends team alerts, and personalises your AI agents' communication.

Provide the following: - Organisation name and website URL - Contact details — phone number, address, city, and country - Primary account owner — name and email address

Terms & Trial Activation

Accepting the Terms of Service activates your 30-day free trial instantly. Your workspace is ready immediately — no setup calls, no approval queues, and no credit card required to start.

docs.title: Step 4: Complete the Onboarding Wizard
docs.text:
Once registered, a guided four-step wizard personalises your Vortex IQ experience:

Step 1 — Tell Us Your Interests Select which operational areas matter most: SEO & Content, Revenue Monitoring, Analytics & Reporting, or Automation & Agents. This helps Vortex IQ surface the most relevant agents and insights for your store.

Step 2 — Connect Your First Data Source Link at least one platform to unlock your Command Centre and begin real-time data synchronisation. Supported during onboarding: Shopify, BigCommerce, Google Analytics, and Facebook Ads. (See Connecting Data Sources for full setup details.)

Step 3 — Review Your Workspace See a summary of your connected sources, selected interest areas, and the agents ready to activate.

Step 4 — Launch Your Command Centre You are live. Your AI OS is active, your 30-day trial has started, and your first agents are standing by.

Connecting Unlocks Everything

Your onboarding is marked complete the moment you connect your first platform. You land directly in your Command Centre, with the Nerve Centre already scanning your store data in real time.

docs.text:
After completing onboarding, you arrive at your personalised Command Centre — the hub of your entire AI Operating System.

The post-login Command Centre: "Welcome to your Command Centre" with Viq introducing herself as the conversational AI for the Vortex IQ Operating System. The left-hand sidebar shows Ask Viq, Vortex Mind, Nerve Centre, Vortex Apps, Agent Hub, Vortex Memory, Get Support, Settings, and Log Out.

docs.title: Outcome & Impact: What Happens After You Connect
docs.text:
The first five minutes of Vortex IQ are by design the last time setup ever feels like work. From the moment your store is connected, the platform runs continuously — no manual configuration, no scheduled maintenance.

Merchants who complete onboarding and activate their first agent within the first session consistently see three immediate outcomes:

  • Instant situational awareness — Your Command Centre begins surfacing KPI cards and trend lines from your connected store data within minutes.
  • Proactive alerts — The Nerve Centre starts monitoring your site health, inventory status, and ad spend efficiency before you even close your browser tab.
  • First agent action within 24 hours — Your first AI recommendation or completed task is typically delivered within the first business day.

The long-term impact is equally significant. Businesses that implement unified AI platforms report 15 to 25% revenue increases within the first 90 days, driven by better personalisation, faster anomaly detection, and more efficient ad targeting (Source: ReferralCandy — eCommerce Data Integration Guide 2026). And 69% of retailers who implemented AI report direct, measurable revenue increases traceable to that adoption (Source: EComposer — AI in eCommerce Statistics 2025).

docs.title: AI Safety & Guardrails: How Vortex IQ Keeps You in Control
docs.text:
From your very first login, every action in Vortex IQ operates within a strict safety framework called AI Guardrails. This is not a setting you enable — it is the foundational architecture of the platform.

Human-in-the-Loop by Default: No AI agent can take a high-impact action — such as publishing a price change, triggering a bulk content update, or issuing a refund — without your explicit review and approval. The AI surfaces the recommendation, presents its reasoning, and waits for your sign-off. You always remain the decision-maker.

Role-Based Access from Day One: Your workspace is provisioned with three pre-configured access levels during registration. Every team member you invite works within clearly defined boundaries: - Administrator — Full access to all settings, AI configuration, and security controls. - Manager — Can activate and deactivate agents, approve agent actions, and view all dashboards. - User (Viewer) — Can view the Command Centre and reports but cannot interact with agents or approve changes.

Zero PII Storage: When you connect your store, Vortex IQ processes aggregated business signals — it does not store your customers' personally identifiable information (PII). Only anonymised patterns are used to power recommendations, in full compliance with GDPR and CCPA.

Encrypted Credentials: Every platform connection is secured with industry-standard OAuth 2.0 authorisation and encrypted credential storage. Your store access tokens are encrypted before saving and are never displayed in plain text after the initial connection.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Q: Do I need technical knowledge or developer support to set up Vortex IQ? No. The entire onboarding process — from account creation to connecting your first store — is designed for non-technical merchants and operators. There is no code to write, no files to configure, and no developer required at any point.

Q: What is the difference between "Get Magic Link" and signing up with Google? Both are passwordless and highly secure. "Get Magic Link" sends a one-time secure link to your email — click it to sign in with no password required. "Sign up with Google" uses your existing Google Workspace credentials to authenticate instantly. Google sign-in is the fastest option if you already use Google at work.

Q: Can I connect multiple stores to one account? Yes. Partner Accounts are designed to manage multiple client storefronts from a single workspace, each with its own isolated data and agent configuration. Merchant Accounts support a primary store with the ability to add additional platform integrations from Settings at any time.

Q: What happens to my data if I cancel my subscription? Your workspace data is retained for 30 days after cancellation, giving you time to export reports or reconnect if you change your mind. Vortex IQ does not store your customers' personal information at any point during or after your subscription.

Q: What platforms can I connect during the initial onboarding wizard? During onboarding you can connect Shopify, BigCommerce, Google Analytics (GA4), and Facebook Ads. Additional platforms — including Adobe Commerce, Google Ads, Stripe, Slack, and Microsoft Teams — can be added at any time from the Settings → Connected Sources page after your workspace is active.

Instead of logging into BigCommerce, Stripe, and Google Analytics separately, the Nerve Centre unifies these Signals into a single dashboard for tracking KPIs, historical trends, and setting automated alerts.

docs.title: Vortex Mind — Strategic Intelligence Engine for eCommerce | Vortex IQ Help Centre
Vortex Mind
docs.text: Vortex Mind is the proactive strategic intelligence layer of the Vortex IQ AI OS. While Ask Viq answers questions on demand, Vortex Mind continuously analyses your performance data and generates comprehensive intelligence reports — including KPI analysis, product performance reviews, competitive benchmarking, and strategic recommendations — either on demand or on a schedule you define. It is the difference between reacting to data and being briefed before the meeting starts.

docs.title: Why Strategic Intelligence Matters More Than Reactive Reporting
docs.text:
Most eCommerce teams operate in reactive mode: a metric drops, someone notices, a meeting is called, and by the time a response is agreed upon, the opportunity has passed. Traditional analytics dashboards make data available, but they do not surface insight — they require a human analyst to spot the pattern, form the hypothesis, and draft the recommendation.

Vortex Mind changes this by functioning as a proactive intelligence partner. It scans your connected data continuously and synthesises findings into structured reports that combine context, comparison, and recommended action in a single document.

The commercial case for this shift is significant. AI-powered business intelligence and personalisation can increase revenue by up to 41% for merchants who apply it consistently, and companies that excel at data-driven decision-making are reported to be significantly more likely to outperform competitors in customer acquisition and profitability (Source: Envive.ai — AI Personalization in eCommerce Lift Statistics 2026; McKinsey & Company). For teams managing the daily complexity of multi-channel eCommerce, Vortex Mind delivers a structured answer to one of the most valuable questions in business: not just what happened, but what it means and what to do next.

The impact on operational efficiency is equally clear. 89% of companies report positive ROI from AI-powered personalisation and intelligence tools, with an average payback period of just 9 months (Source: Envive.ai — AI Implementation Statistics 2026). Merchants who adopt automated intelligence briefings consistently report reducing the time spent on weekly performance reviews by up to 50% — time redirected towards the strategic decisions that require human judgement (Source: EComposer — AI in eCommerce Statistics 2025).

docs.title: The Four Pillars of Vortex Mind
docs.text:
Vortex Mind structures its intelligence output around four core capabilities, each designed to answer a different dimension of your business performance:

KPI Analysis Deep-dive performance analysis across your key business metrics — revenue, conversion rate, average order value, and return on ad spend — with trend lines, historical benchmarks, and AI-generated interpretation of what the numbers mean. Product Performance Identify your best-selling products, your highest-return items, and the inventory positions that need attention — surfaced automatically before they become costly problems. Competitor Analysis Benchmark your store's performance against industry trends and competitive signals, identifying opportunities to differentiate your positioning or defend your market share. Strategic Recommendations AI-generated action plans — prioritised by expected impact — that translate your performance data into a clear, ranked list of next steps for your team to execute.

docs.title: Step 1: Open Vortex Mind
docs.text:
Click Vortex Mind in the left-hand navigation sidebar. The Vortex Mind home screen presents an overview of the platform's capabilities alongside a video walkthrough and the four core feature tiles: KPI Analysis, Product Performance, Competitor Analysis, and Strategic Recommendations.

From this screen you have two primary actions available: - Generate a Report — create a new intelligence report from your connected data, on demand. - View Reports — access your full report history, individual report documents, and scheduled report management.

The Vortex Mind home screen: four intelligence pillars presented as feature tiles — KPI Analysis, Product Performance, Competitor Analysis, and Strategic Recommendations — with direct action buttons to generate a new report or browse existing reports.

docs.title: Step 2: Generate a Report
docs.text:
Click Generate a Report. The report generation screen presents a structured configuration form with three elements:

  1. Select Store — choose which connected storefront this report should analyse.
  2. Select Date Range — define the reporting period for the analysis.
  3. Choose Report Sections — an accordion selector lets you choose which intelligence sections to include. Available sections are:
  4. Introduction — executive overview of highlights and anomalies for the period
  5. Competitive Analysis — benchmarking against industry trends and competitive signals
  6. Benchmark — performance comparison against your historical baselines
  7. KPI — deep-dive analysis of your key performance indicators
  8. Seasonal — seasonal trend analysis and upcoming opportunity mapping
  9. Product — product-level performance review across your catalogue
  10. Podcast — a downloadable audio summary of the full report

Once configured, Vortex Mind assembles the selected sections from your live connected data and delivers the completed report to your View Reports tab.

The Generate Report configuration screen: select your store and date range, then use the section accordion to choose which intelligence modules to include — from KPI deep-dives to the Podcast audio briefing.

docs.title: Step 3: View Your Reports
docs.text:
Click the View Reports tab to access your complete report history. Each report in the list displays the store it covers, the date range analysed, the sections included, and the date it was generated. Click any report to open the full document.

The View Reports tab: a chronological list of all generated intelligence reports, each showing the store analysed, the reporting period, and the sections included — click any entry to open the full report document.

docs.title: Step 4: Read and Download Individual Reports
docs.text:
Opening a report reveals the full structured intelligence document. Each section expands to show the analysis, benchmarks, and recommendations for that area of your business. If you included the Podcast section in your report configuration, a download control appears at the top of the report — click it to download the audio briefing version of the same intelligence content.

An individual Vortex Mind report: structured intelligence sections expand inline, and the podcast download control appears at the top of the document for audio-format consumption of the same insights.

docs.title: Step 5: Schedule Automated Reports
docs.text:
To receive intelligence briefings on a recurring schedule without manual generation, navigate to the Scheduled Reports tab within View Reports. Your existing scheduled report configurations are listed here, each showing the store, sections, recurrence frequency, and delivery status.

The Scheduled Reports list: active report schedules showing the store analysed, intelligence sections included, recurrence frequency, and delivery configuration for each automated briefing.

To create a new schedule: 1. Click Create Schedule from the Scheduled Reports screen. 2. Configure the store, report sections, date range logic (e.g., previous 7 days, previous calendar month), and delivery frequency (daily, weekly, monthly). 3. Save the schedule — Vortex Mind will generate and deliver the report automatically at the configured interval, adding each new report to your View Reports history.

The Create Schedule form: configure the store, intelligence sections, date range logic, and delivery frequency to fully automate your recurring reporting and briefing workflow.

docs.title: Extended Intelligence Capabilities
docs.text:
Vortex Mind's architecture supports an expanding set of strategic intelligence features. The following capabilities are part of the platform's intelligence roadmap and are enabled by the same underlying infrastructure that powers the core report engine:

Executive Summaries: A high-level business briefing — wins, risks, and recommended focus areas — delivered as a concise summary designed for senior leadership consumption. Combines KPI highlights, product signals, and the top three recommended actions into a single, scannable document.

Competitor Intelligence: Proactive alerts when competitive signals change in your category — price movements, new product launches, or shifts in promotional strategy — so your team can respond before the impact reaches your own metrics.

Podcast Briefings: For busy eCommerce leaders, the Podcast section generates a downloadable audio summary of the full intelligence document. Listen during your commute or between meetings and stay fully briefed without reading a report.

Podcast Reports Are Available Now

The Podcast section is available today as a selectable option in the Generate Report configuration screen. Include it in any report to receive a downloadable audio version of your intelligence briefing alongside the full written document.

docs.title: AI Safety & Guardrails
docs.text:
Vortex Mind operates as a read-only intelligence layer. It analyses, summarises, and recommends — it does not modify your store data, publishing settings, or campaign configurations without your explicit instruction.

Human-in-the-Loop Design: When Vortex Mind surfaces a Strategic Recommendation that involves a specific action, it presents the recommendation as a proposal with supporting data. Acting on that recommendation requires navigating to the relevant agent or explicitly initiating the action within the appropriate workflow. No automated changes occur from the intelligence layer alone.

Data Scope: All reports are generated exclusively from data you have linked to your workspace through Settings → Connected Sources. Vortex Mind cannot access data from platforms that are not actively connected to your account.

Access Control: Report generation and schedule management are available to users with Manager or Administrator privileges. Users with the Viewer role can read and download existing reports but cannot generate new ones or create or modify scheduled report configurations.

Audit Trail: Report generation events — including which store was analysed, which sections were included, who triggered the report, and when it was delivered — are logged in your Audit Trail.

Coverage Note

The Competitive Analysis section of Vortex Mind reports is based on industry benchmark data available through your connected platforms. Live competitor price-change alerts and real-time competitive signal monitoring are part of the Vortex Mind intelligence roadmap.

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Q: How is Vortex Mind different from Ask Viq? Ask Viq is reactive — it answers your questions on demand in a conversational interface. Vortex Mind is proactive — it generates comprehensive, structured intelligence reports across multiple sections of your business, either on demand or on an automated schedule. The two are complementary: Ask Viq is your analyst on call; Vortex Mind is your scheduled strategic briefing.

Q: Can I schedule reports to deliver automatically? Yes. The Scheduled Reports feature within Vortex Mind lets you configure daily, weekly, or monthly report delivery. Each schedule specifies which store to analyse, which sections to include, and what date range logic to apply. Reports are generated automatically and added to your View Reports history at the configured interval.

Q: Does Vortex Mind support multiple stores in the same report? Each report is scoped to a single connected store. If you manage multiple storefronts, you can create separate report configurations — or separate schedules — for each. Partner Account users can access Vortex Mind independently for each client workspace using the workspace switcher.

Q: What is the Podcast section in a Vortex Mind report? When you include the Podcast section in your report configuration, Vortex Mind generates a downloadable audio summary of the full intelligence briefing alongside the written document. This allows you or your leadership team to consume the report as an audio briefing — useful for remote teams, commuting, or situations where a full document review is not practical.

Q: How far back can I run a Vortex Mind report? The date range is configurable at the time of report generation. Historical data availability depends on how long your connected platforms have been linked to your workspace. Platforms connected during onboarding will have data from that date forward; the full historical range available within each platform's own data retention limits applies.

docs.title: Overview: The Agent Hub
docs.text:
The Agent Hub is the central repository for your digital workforce. It displays all active, available agents in a grid view, categorized by function (e.g., Analytics, E-Commerce Ops, Media Management).

From this screen, users can: * Access Agents: Launch existing agents like "Page Speed & Web Vitals" or "Product SEO" to perform tasks immediately. * Build New Agents: Click the purple "Agent Builder" button in the top-right corner to enter the creation studio.

docs.title: The Visual Agent Builder
docs.text:
Transforming APIs into autonomous workers.

The Agent Builder Studio guides you through a strict 4-step pipeline to create safe, reliable agents:

  1. Select Connectors
  2. Workflow Plan
  3. Review & Test
  4. Deploy Agent

docs.title: API-to-Agent Mapping (Connecting Data)
docs.text:
The core of any agent is its ability to talk to external tools. You can map APIs using two methods:

A. Select Existing Connector Choose from pre-integrated platforms like BigCommerce or Shopify. These come with pre-mapped "Skills" (e.g., Sync Inventory, Update Product Metafields).

B. Build Custom Connector (API Mapping) If the integration doesn't exist, click "+ Add Custom Connector" to launch the interactive builder. * Conversational Mapping: A chat assistant asks, "Please describe what API or data source you need". You can simply type, "Connect to the Stripe API to read transaction history." * Postman Import: For precise control, upload a Postman Collection (.json). The builder parses this file to automatically map every API endpoint to a callable agent function.

docs.title: Version Control & Logic Management
docs.text:
Iterating without breaking production.

To meet enterprise standards, the Agent Hub enforces versioning on all custom agents.

  • Immutable Snapshots: Every time you reach the "Deploy Agent" step, the system saves the current logic, API mappings, and prompt instructions as a distinct version (e.g., v1.0).
  • Rollback Capability: If a new version (e.g., v1.2 of "Product SEO Agent") introduces errors or "hallucinations," you can revert the agent to v1.1 instantly. This restores the previous API mappings and logic flow, ensuring business continuity.

docs.title: Agent Categories & Use Cases
docs.text:
Once built, agents appear in the Hub under specific categories based on their capabilities:

Category Example Agents Function Analytics Google Analytics Insights Monitors traffic trends and alerts on anomalies. Operations StagingPro - BigCommerce Manages environment migrations and safe rollbacks. Marketing Campaign Manager - DotDigital Automates email creation and campaign tracking. Utils Image Optimisation Compress and resize assets automatically via API.

docs.text:

docs.title: Vortex Memory
docs.text:
Vortex Memory is a centralized file management and preview workspace within VortexIQ. It allows users to upload, organize, and access supporting files (any of these file types PDF, JPG, PNG, CSV (Max 50MB)) that can be referenced across the platform.

This page acts as a secure document repository connected to your store environment.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Vortex Memory interface is divided into three primary sections:

  1. Header Bar
  2. File Management Panel (Left Sidebar)
  3. File Preview Workspace (Main Panel)

docs.title: 1. Header Bar
docs.text:
The top bar provides high-level system status and file metrics:

  • Files Count – Displays the total number of uploaded files.
  • Storage Size – Shows the cumulative storage usage.
  • Store Connected – Indicates active connection to the store.
  • User Profile (Top Right) – Displays the currently logged-in user.

This section gives quick visibility into storage usage and connection status.

docs.title: 2. File Management Panel (Left Sidebar)
docs.text: This panel is used to manage and organize files.

docs.title: Search Files
docs.text: A search input field allows users to quickly locate uploaded files by name.

docs.title: Upload Files
docs.text:
Users can upload files directly into Vortex Memory.

Supported formats:

  • PDF
  • JPG
  • PNG
  • CSV

Maximum file size: 50MB per file

Files uploaded here become available for preview and use within the system.

docs.title: Filters
docs.text: The Filters section enables sorting or narrowing down files based on defined criteria (if configured).

docs.title: Empty State
docs.text:
If no files are uploaded, the system displays:

“No files yet – Upload your first file to get started.”

docs.title: 3. File Preview Workspace (Main Panel)
docs.text:
The right-hand panel is the file preview area.

  • When no file is selected, it displays:

“Select a file to preview – Click on any file from the left to view its contents here.” * When a file is selected, its contents are rendered in this panel for viewing.

This separation ensures file management and file previewing remain cleanly organized.

docs.title: Typical Use Cases
docs.text:
Vortex Memory can be used for:

  • Storing product-related assets
  • Managing documentation (PDF guides, specs)
  • Uploading CSV files for data operations
  • Supporting AI-driven workflows within VortexIQ
  • Centralized access to frequently used files

docs.title: Key Benefits

Vortex Memory is designed to ensure that important files are accessible, organized, and integrated into your operational workflows without leaving the VortexIQ platform.
