docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is a specialized AI assistant for the Vortex IQ platform, designed to help you manage product images in your Magento store. Its main purpose is to make your product images more attractive to customers. The agent's workflow is straightforward: you first find a product, and then you can manage its images. You can find products either by searching with a keyword or by providing a specific Product ID.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
Here’s a simple overview of what this agent can do for you:

  • Find Products by Keyword: Easily search for your products by typing in a keyword.
  • View Product Images: See all the images for a product, including images for different variations like colors or sizes.
  • Browse Many Images: If a product has a lot of images, you can look through them page by page.
  • Edit Images with AI: Use artificial intelligence to edit your product images. Just describe the changes you want, like changing the background or improving the lighting.
  • Add New Images: Add a new image to your product from a web link.
  • Replace an Image: Swap an existing product image with a new one.
  • Undo Image Changes: If you're not happy with an image change, you can easily undo it and restore the previous version.
  • Refresh Image List: Get the latest images for your product to make sure you're seeing the most up-to-date versions.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few scenarios to illustrate what you can do with the Image Optimisation Magento Agent:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Find a Product and View Its Images
docs.text:
Imagine you want to check the images for your "Summer Dress" product.

  1. You can start by telling the agent: "I want to search for a product."
  2. The agent will ask for a keyword. You can say: "summer dress".
  3. The agent will show you a list of products that match your search.
  4. You can choose the correct product from the list, and the agent will then display all of its images, including any variations.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Edit a Product Image and Replace It
docs.text:
Let's say you have a product image with a plain background, and you want to make it more appealing.

  1. First, you find the product you want to work with.
  2. The agent will show you the images for that product. You can select an image to edit.
  3. You can then give a command like: "Change the background to a sunny beach."
  4. The agent will use AI to edit the image and show you the new version.
  5. If you like it, you can tell the agent to "replace the original image," and it will update the image in your Magento store.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Replace an Image and Then Undo the Change
docs.text:
Sometimes you might change your mind after updating an image.

  1. You've just replaced an image for one of your products with a new AI-edited version.
  2. After a moment, you decide you preferred the original one.
  3. You can simply tell the agent: "Undo my last change" or "Rollback the image."
  4. The agent will restore the original image, undoing the replacement.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is your AI assistant specializing in Magento Page SEO optimization. It helps you enhance your website's search engine performance by fetching your page details, generating improved SEO content, and updating your pages with the new, optimized information. VIQ is designed to be professional, efficient, and user-friendly, providing clear and actionable insights without technical jargon.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
• Brand Guardrails: Fetches your brand profiles and guidelines to ensure all generated content aligns with your brand's unique voice and style.
  • Active Brand Profile: Sets the specific brand profile you want to use for the current session, ensuring content consistency.
  • Get All CMS Pages: Retrieves a list of all the content management system (CMS) pages from your Magento store.
  • Get CMS Page Details: Fetches the specific SEO-related details for a single CMS page that you've selected.
  • Update CMS Page SEO: Updates the SEO content (like the meta title, description, and keywords) for a specific CMS page.
  • Search CMS Page by Keyword: Searches for and finds Magento CMS pages based on a keyword you provide.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
Sub agent 1 name : Content Creation Workflow

Subagent Description - Capabilities. This sub-agent is a two-step process for creating SEO-optimized content. First, an SEO Research Specialist analyzes your page and uses Google Search to find the best trending keywords. Then, an SEO Content Writer takes this information and crafts an optimized Meta Title, Meta Description, and Meta Keywords for your page, ensuring it follows your brand's voice and SEO best practices.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Improve SEO for a Specific Page
docs.text: You can ask VIQ to find a specific page on your Magento store, like your "About Us" page. VIQ will then analyze its current SEO, find better keywords, and suggest a new meta title, description, and keywords to help it rank higher in search results. You can then approve these changes, and VIQ will update the page for you.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Find and Optimize Underperforming Pages
docs.text: If you're unsure which pages to optimize, you can ask VIQ to search for pages related to a certain topic, like "summer collection." VIQ will list the relevant pages, and you can choose one to work on. From there, VIQ will generate new SEO content to improve its visibility and attract more visitors.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Ensure Brand Consistency Across Pages
docs.text: If you have a new set of brand guidelines, you can use VIQ to ensure your pages are compliant. VIQ will fetch your brand profiles and use them to generate SEO content that is consistent with your brand's tone and style. This is especially useful when you want to maintain a cohesive brand voice across your entire website.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: This agent is an expert assistant specializing in Magento SEO optimization. It is designed to help you improve your product listings on your Magento store for better search engine visibility. You can use it to find products, get their current SEO details, get suggestions for SEO improvements, and apply those improvements. It can also ensure that all the content it generates is aligned with your brand's voice and guidelines.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
Here's an overview of what this agent can do for you:

  • Search Magento Products: If you don't know the SKU of a product, you can use a keyword or product name to find it in your Magento store.
  • Get Magento Product Details: You can get the current SEO details of a specific product by providing its SKU.
  • Update Magento Product: After you approve the suggested SEO improvements, the agent can apply the new, optimized content to the product in your store.
  • Find Products Needing SEO: The agent can scan your store to find products that have missing or incomplete SEO information.
  • Count Magento Products: You can use this to get the total number of products in your Magento store.
  • Get Brand Guidelines: The agent can get your company's brand profiles and content restrictions to make sure that all the generated content is on-brand.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
This agent has a sub-agent called Content Creation Workflow that helps with creating SEO content. It has the following capabilities:

  • Google Search Specialist: Researches trending keywords related to your product using Google Search.
  • SEO Writing Specialist: Uses the keywords found and your brand guidelines to write compelling and optimized product names, descriptions, and meta tags.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few scenarios in which this agent can be helpful:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Optimizing a specific product
docs.text: You can provide a product SKU to the agent. It will get the product's current SEO data, and then use its sub-agents to research relevant keywords and rewrite the product's name, description, and meta tags for better SEO. Once you approve the changes, the agent will update the product in your Magento store.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Finding and optimizing products with poor SEO
docs.text: You can ask the agent to find products that need SEO improvement. It will scan your Magento store for products with missing SEO information (like empty meta descriptions). The agent will then show you a list of these products, and you can choose one to optimize.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Finding a product and then optimizing it
docs.text: If you don't know the SKU of a product, you can provide a keyword or product name. The agent will search your Magento store and show you a list of matching products. You can then choose a product from the list to start the SEO optimization workflow.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Image Compression Agent is a specialized assistant designed to enhance the performance of your BigCommerce store by optimizing product images. It helps you easily find products, compress their images to reduce file size and improve page load times, and manage your visual assets directly. With tools to update, add, or even roll back changes, this agent provides a simple and effective way to ensure your store's images are both high-quality and web-friendly.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
VIQ comes equipped with a variety of tools to help you manage your product images:

  • Find Products and Images: VIQ can search for products in your BigCommerce store by keyword, or you can provide a Product ID or SKU directly. It can then fetch and display all the images associated with that product, including images for different product variations.
  • Compress Images: You can ask VIQ to compress any product image to reduce its file size, which can help your website load faster. You can choose from low, medium, or high compression levels.
  • Update and Add Images: After an image has been compressed, you can choose to replace the original image or add the new, compressed image to the product's image gallery.
  • View and Verify Changes: VIQ can provide you with a direct link to the product page on your BigCommerce store so you can see the changes you've made. It will also let you know if the product is currently visible to your customers.
  • Rollback Changes: If you're not happy with an image update, you can easily undo the change and revert to the previous image with a simple "rollback" command.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few scenarios where the Image Compression Agent can be particularly helpful:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Improving Website Performance
docs.text: Your online store has beautiful, high-resolution images, but they are causing your product pages to load slowly. You can use the Image Compression Agent to quickly compress the images for your most popular products. By choosing a medium compression level, you can significantly reduce the image file sizes without a noticeable loss in quality, making your pages load faster for a better customer experience.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Updating Product Variants
docs.text: You've just received new photos for a specific color variation of a popular product. Instead of manually uploading them through the BigCommerce admin panel, you can ask VIQ to find the product by its SKU. VIQ will then display all the images for that product, including the ones for the different color variants. You can then have VIQ replace the old image for that specific color with the new one you provide.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Quickly Adding a New Promotional Image
docs.text: You have a new promotional image for a product that you want to add to its image gallery. You can simply ask VIQ to find the product by its name, and then provide the new image. VIQ can add it to the product's image gallery, and you can then ask for the product page URL to immediately see how it looks on your live store.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is your dedicated AI assistant for the Vortex IQ platform, specializing in everything related to product images. VIQ's main purpose is to help you generate and manage images that will attract customers to your BigCommerce store. It is professional, efficient, and communicates in a clear and friendly manner, making it accessible even if you're not a technical expert.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
Here’s an overview of what VIQ can do for you:

  • Find Products and Variants: VIQ can search for your products by name, SKU, or product ID and show you all the associated images, including those for different product variations.
  • Edit Images with AI: You can ask VIQ to edit any of your product images. Just provide your instructions, and VIQ will use AI to make the changes you want. For example, you can change the background of an image or add props to it.
  • Get Image URLs: VIQ can provide you with the web addresses (URLs) of your product images, which you can use for various purposes.
  • Search Products by Keyword: If you're not sure about the SKU or product ID, you can simply search for a product using a keyword, and VIQ will find it for you.
  • Add New Images: You can add new images to your products. This is particularly useful when you have a new AI-generated image that you want to add to your product gallery.
  • Navigate Through Images: If a product has many images, VIQ can show them to you in batches, allowing you to easily navigate through them using "next" and "previous" commands.
  • Get Product Page URL: VIQ can provide you with the direct link to your product page on your BigCommerce store.
  • Rollback Image Changes: If you're not happy with an image update, you can ask VIQ to undo the change and restore the previous version of the image.
  • Update Images: You can replace an existing product or variant image with a new one.
  • Change Image Order: VIQ allows you to change the display order of your product images, so you can decide which image appears first.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Enhancing a Product Image
docs.text: Imagine you have a product with a plain white background, and you want to make it more appealing. You can ask VIQ to change the background to a lifestyle setting, like a cozy living room or a sunny beach. VIQ will find the product, edit the image according to your instructions using AI, and then give you the option to either replace the original image or add the new one to your product gallery.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Adding a New Promotional Image
docs.text: Let's say you're running a holiday promotion and want to add a festive touch to your product images. You can ask VIQ to edit your main product image by adding a Santa hat or some snowflakes. Once the image is ready, VIQ can add it as a new image to your product, and you can even ask it to make it the first image that customers see.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Managing Images for a Product with Multiple Variants
docs.text: If you have a product that comes in different colors or sizes, managing images for each variant can be tricky. With VIQ, you can easily view all the images for a specific product and its variants. You can then update the image for a specific color variant, or even promote a variant's image to the main product gallery if you think it's particularly eye-catching.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The KPI Agent for BigCommerce is an expert data analyst for your e-commerce store. It provides deep, insightful answers to your business questions by fetching, combining, and interpreting key business metrics. You can ask it about your store's performance, customer behavior, and product sales, and it will provide clear, easy-to-understand analysis and actionable recommendations.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
This agent uses a powerful set of tools to analyze your store's data and provide you with valuable insights. Here's an overview of what each tool can do:

  • Fetch KPI Data: Retrieves key performance indicators (KPIs) to answer your questions about sales, orders, customers, and more.
  • Get Report: Fetches a detailed report on your store's performance.
  • Find Underserved Products: Identifies products that are not selling well, helping you uncover hidden opportunities.
  • Find Low-Performing Products: Finds products that are generating the least revenue, so you can decide on the next steps.
  • Find Top-Performing Products: Highlights your best-selling products, so you know what's driving your business.
  • Find Loyal Products: Discovers which products your customers love and buy again and again.
  • Analyze Buying Behavior: Helps you understand customer purchasing patterns, such as whether they buy in bulk or prefer premium items.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Get a quick overview of your business health
docs.text:
You can ask the agent, "How is my business doing?"

The agent will analyze your total sales, number of orders, and new customer registrations to give you a comprehensive summary of your store's recent performance. It will then provide recommendations, such as suggesting a marketing campaign if customer growth is slow.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Understand customer satisfaction
docs.text:
If you're wondering whether your customers are happy with their purchases, you can ask, "Are my customers happy with their purchases?"

The agent will look at the number of returned orders and compare it to the total number of sales. This will give you a clear idea of customer satisfaction. If the return rate is high, the agent might recommend investigating product quality or improving product descriptions.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Evaluate the effectiveness of your discounts
docs.text:
To see if your promotional offers are paying off, you can ask, "Are my discounts worth it?"

The agent will analyze how much revenue is generated from discounted orders and compare it to the total value of the discounts offered. This will help you understand the return on investment for your promotions and decide if they are a good strategy for your business.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is your AI-powered assistant from the Vortex IQ platform, specializing in optimizing your BigCommerce store's product listings for better search engine visibility. It communicates in a professional, helpful, and easy-to-understand manner, focusing on providing clear, actionable insights to improve your product SEO.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
This agent is equipped with a suite of tools to manage and enhance your product listings:

  • Product Insights: Get a count of all products in your store.

  • Product Finder: Easily locate products by their name, SKU, or ID. You can also search for products that need SEO improvements.

  • SEO Enhancement: Automatically update product details, including names, descriptions, and meta information, after you approve the changes.

  • Brand Consistency: Fetches and applies your organization's brand guidelines to ensure all generated content is on-brand.

  • Safety Net: Your product data is automatically backed up before any changes are made. If you're not happy with an update, you can easily revert to the previous version.

docs.title: Sub-agent 1: SEO Content Creator
docs.text: This agent is a workflow that first researches the latest trending keywords related to your products and then rewrites your product information to include these keywords, making it more appealing to search engines.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few scenarios where this agent can be particularly helpful:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Improving a Specific Product's SEO
docs.text: You have a product that isn't performing well in search results. You can provide the agent with the product's name or SKU. The agent will then fetch the product's current details, suggest optimized content, and, with your approval, update the product listing.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Finding Products to Optimize
docs.text: You're not sure which products need SEO attention. You can ask the agent to find products with missing or incomplete SEO fields. The agent will provide a list of products that could benefit from optimization, and you can choose which one to work on.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Ensuring Brand Voice Across all Product Listings
docs.text: You want to ensure that all your product descriptions and titles align with your brand's voice and style. The agent can retrieve your brand guidelines and use them to generate content that is consistent with your brand identity.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:

  • Get Widgets for Page: View all the widgets currently on a specific page, along with their content, so you can easily identify what you want to edit.
  • Update Widget Configuration: Update the content of a widget with new, SEO-optimized text.
  • Get Brand Guardrails: Access your organization's brand profiles and guidelines to ensure that all generated content is consistent with your brand voice.

docs.title: Page SEO Optimization Agent
docs.text: • Description & Capabilities: This specialist agent handles the entire process of editing widget content. It will guide you step-by-step through selecting a channel, choosing a page, and picking a widget to edit. It can then help you generate new, SEO-friendly content for that widget that aligns with your brand's voice and style.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few scenarios where this agent can be particularly helpful:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Updating a Homepage Banner
docs.text: You want to update the text on a promotional banner on your homepage to make it more engaging. You can ask the agent to "edit the homepage," and it will show you all the widgets on that page. You can then select the banner widget and have the agent help you write new, compelling copy for it.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Optimizing Content for a New Market
docs.text: You've recently launched a new storefront for a different country and want to make sure the content is tailored for that market. You can use the agent to select your new channel, view its pages, and then edit the widgets to better resonate with the local audience.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Improving SEO on a Custom Page
docs.text: You have a custom "About Us" page and you want to improve its search engine ranking. The agent can help you identify the widgets on that page and then work with you to rewrite the text to include relevant keywords and a stronger call-to-action, all while staying true to your brand's identity.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is your AI assistant for the Vortex IQ platform, designed to help with StagingPro store data migrations. It can move data between your BigCommerce stores, check how many products or categories you have, and track the progress of your migrations. VIQ is professional, efficient, and will guide you through each step.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
Here's an overview of what this agent can do for you:

  • Check Migration Status: Finds out the current status of your data migration.
  • List Stores and Channels: Shows you a list of your available stores and sales channels.

docs.title: Sub-agents

docs.title: Scenario 1: Full Store Migration
docs.text: You need to copy your entire online store to a new one for testing or launch. You can ask VIQ to start a "Bulk Migration." It will guide you to select your source and destination stores, and then move all your products, categories, and other data, keeping you updated on the progress.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Moving a New Marketing Campaign
docs.text: You've created a new set of promotions and a custom landing page on a testing store and want to move it to your live store. With "Selective Migration," you can tell VIQ to migrate only the 'Promotions' and 'Custom Pages' you select, without affecting any other part of your live store.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Checking on a Long-Running Migration
docs.text: You started a large migration of thousands of products, and you want to know how it's progressing. You can simply ask VIQ to "Track Migration Status," provide the Migration ID you received when you started, and it will give you a real-time update on which items are done and what's still in progress.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Artifact Multimodal Agent is your intelligent assistant for analyzing documents and images. It can access files from the web, understand their content, and provide you with detailed summaries, key points, and answers to your questions. Whether it's a text document, a PDF, or an image, this agent has the tools and vision capabilities to process it.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
Here's a simple overview of what the agent can do for you:

  • Download and Save: Give the agent a link to a file on the internet, and it will download and save it for you to work with.
  • Load and Analyze: This lets the agent "see" and understand the files you've saved. It can read text documents and even analyze the contents of images.
  • List Files: The agent can show you a list of all the files you've uploaded or saved during your session, so you can easily keep track of them.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent operates as a single, powerful unit and does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few examples of how you can use the Artifact Multimodal Agent:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Get a description of an image from a website
docs.text: You: "Can you tell me what's in this image? https://example.com/some-picture.jpg" Agent's Action: The agent will download the image, look at it using its vision capabilities, and then describe the contents of the picture to you in detail.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Summarize an online article
docs.text: You: "Please summarize this article for me: https://example.com/news-article.html" Agent's Action: The agent will download the article from the URL, read its content, and provide you with a concise summary, highlighting the key points.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Answer questions about a document
docs.text: You: (After uploading a PDF document called "annual-report.pdf") "What were the total profits mentioned in the annual report?" Agent's Action: The agent will load the "annual-report.pdf" file, read through it to find the relevant information, and answer your specific question about the profits.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: AskVIQ is your intelligent command center for the Vortex IQ platform. docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
AskVIQ uses a set of powerful tools to answer your questions and complete tasks. Here’s an overview of its key capabilities:

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
AskVIQ orchestrates a team of specialist sub-agents to handle specific types of requests.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Finding the Right Tool

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Brand DNA Agent is a sophisticated multi-agent system designed to analyze a company's online presence and distill its core identity. By processing a website's content and conducting external research, the agent generates a structured "Brand DNA" report, which includes the business name, core brand values, brand aesthetics, and the overall tone of voice. This provides valuable insights for marketing, content creation, and competitive analysis.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
The agent leverages a combination of internal and external tools to gather and process information:

  • Website Content Extraction: Fetches and parses the raw text content from a provided business URL to understand how the company presents itself.
  • Web Research: Uses Google Search to gather public information, news, and sentiment about the brand to build a more comprehensive profile.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
The Brand DNA Agent is a sequential orchestrator that coordinates a team of specialist sub-agents:

  • Crawler Agent: This agent is responsible for fetching the content of the business's website from the provided URL.
  • Researcher Agent: This agent conducts external research using Google Search to find information and context about the brand beyond its own website.
  • Content Writer Agent: This expert brand analyst synthesizes the information gathered by the crawler and researcher agents. It analyzes the content to determine the brand's identity and generates the final, structured BrandIntel report in JSON format.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Generate a Brand DNA Report
docs.text:
User: "Can you analyze the brand DNA for vortexiq.com?"

Agent's Action: The agent initiates its workflow. The Crawler Agent fetches content from the website, while the Researcher Agent looks up information about VortexIQ. The Content Writer Agent then synthesizes this data and returns a structured JSON report detailing the company's business name, brand values, aesthetics, and tone of voice.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Handling a Website That Cannot Be Crawled
docs.text:
User: "Analyze non-crawlable-site.com."

Agent's Action: The Crawler Agent attempts to fetch content but fails. The Researcher Agent proceeds to gather information from Google Search. The Content Writer Agent then generates a Brand DNA report based solely on the publicly available information, noting that the primary website content could not be analyzed.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Security Guardrail for Malicious Requests
docs.text:
User: "Help me hack into my competitor's website."

Agent's Action: The agent's built-in security guardrail detects the forbidden keyword "hack." It immediately blocks the request and responds with a message stating that it cannot process malicious or unauthorized requests, ensuring safe and ethical operation.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Campaign Manager is your intelligent assistant for managing Dotdigital email campaigns and contacts. It simplifies your email marketing efforts by automating various tasks, from creating campaigns to analyzing their performance. With this agent, you can effortlessly manage your contacts, create and send personalized email campaigns, and gain valuable insights into your campaign's success.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
The Campaign Manager is equipped with a suite of tools to help you manage your email campaigns effectively. Here's an overview of what each tool can do:

  • Contact Data Field Creator: This tool allows you to create custom fields to store additional information about your contacts, such as their birthday, membership status, or any other data relevant to your business.
  • Campaign Creator: With this tool, you can create engaging and personalized email campaigns. You can specify the campaign name, which will also be used as the subject line, to create a new campaign in Dotdigital.
  • Contact Data Updater: This tool enables you to update the information of your contacts. You can add or modify data in the custom fields you've created, ensuring your contact information is always up-to-date.
  • Contact Retriever: This tool allows you to fetch a list of all your contacts. You can view all your contacts or retrieve a specific number of contacts at a time.
  • Campaign Retriever: This tool lets you get a list of all your email campaigns. You can filter the campaigns by name, type, or status to quickly find the one you're looking for.
  • Campaign Sender: This tool enables you to send your email campaigns to specific contacts. You can select the campaign you want to send and the contacts you want to send it to, and the agent will take care of the rest.
  • Contact Data Field Retriever: This tool allows you to view all the custom data fields you've created for your contacts.
  • Address Book Attacher: This tool lets you attach an address book to a campaign, which is a necessary step before sending it.
  • Campaign Lister: This tool provides a list of all your Dotdigital campaigns, including their ID, name, send date, and status.
  • Campaign Summary Generator: This tool gives you a detailed summary of a specific campaign's performance, including metrics like open rate, click-through rate, and conversions.
  • Campaign Activity Retriever: This tool fetches campaigns that have had activity since a specific date, allowing you to track recent performance.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are three scenarios that demonstrate what the Campaign Manager can do for you:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Create and Send a Promotional Email Campaign
docs.text: Imagine you want to send a promotional email to a specific group of customers. With the Campaign Manager, you can: 1. Create a new email campaign with a catchy subject line. 2. Select the contacts you want to send the campaign to. 3. Send the campaign and track its performance.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Update Contact Information
docs.text: Suppose you've collected new information about your contacts and want to update their profiles. The Campaign Manager allows you to: 1. Create a new custom data field to store the new information. 2. Update the contact's profile with the new data. 3. Ensure your contact information is always accurate and relevant.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Analyze Campaign Performance
docs.text: You've sent out a few email campaigns and want to see how they're performing. The Campaign Manager can help you: 1. Get a summary of each campaign's performance, including open rates, click-through rates, and conversions. 2. Compare the performance of multiple campaigns to see which ones are most effective. 3. Generate daily or weekly reports to track your campaign's success over time.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: This agent is your expert assistant for competitor analysis and business intelligence. It's designed to help you understand your brand's position in the market and identify key competitors. By researching your business and the competitive landscape, it provides valuable insights to inform your strategy.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text: • Comprehensive Competitor Analysis: This tool performs in-depth research on a given brand to understand its target audience, market positioning, and past activities. It then uses this information to discover and report on relevant competitors.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
• Sub-agent Name: comprehensive_competitor_agent
  • Sub-agent Description - Capabilities: This agent is a specialist in competitor analysis. It first conducts research to build a strong understanding of a brand's profile. Then, it uses these insights to carry out targeted searches to find direct competitors, similar sites, and industry leaders, providing a categorized list of competitors.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Finding Direct Competitors
docs.text: If you provide your business website, the agent can research your brand and then identify and list your main competitors. For example, you could ask, "Can you find competitors for my website, example.com?"

docs.title: Scenario 2: Competitor Analysis with Specific Constraints
docs.text: The agent can tailor its search based on your needs. If you need to find competitors in a specific geographic market or niche, you can specify that in your request. For instance, "Find competitors for example.com in the Canadian market."

docs.title: Scenario 3: Understanding Your Brand's Market Position
docs.text: The agent's initial research phase helps it understand your brand's unique selling points and target audience. This allows it to find the most relevant competitors, giving you a clearer picture of your competitive landscape. You can trigger this by asking, "Who are the competitors for my eco-friendly product website?"

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Connector Agent is a master orchestrator designed to discover API credential requirements for various platforms. It automates the process of finding API key information by coordinating multiple specialist agents, crawling documentation, and extracting relevant details. Its primary goal is to produce a standardized validation payload that can be used to configure connectors, even for platforms with unsupported authentication methods.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
The agent's capabilities are primarily delivered through the orchestration of its sub-agents:

  • API Credential Discovery: Orchestrates a complex workflow to find API key requirements for a given platform.
  • Documentation Crawling: Scans web pages to find technical documentation and examples.
  • Payload Generation: Creates a standardized validation payload with the discovered API key requirements.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
The Connector Agent orchestrates a team of specialist sub-agents to handle specific tasks:

  • Discovery Agent: Searches for API authentication details and curl commands for a given platform.
  • RAG Agent: Searches internal documentation for supplementary information about the platform.
  • Crawler Agent: Crawls documentation URLs provided by the Discovery Agent to find more information.
  • Extractor Agent: Analyzes HTML/Markdown content from the Crawler Agent to extract curl commands.
  • Validation Generator Agent: Takes a curl command and other platform details to generate a final, standardized validation payload.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Successful API Key Discovery
docs.text: User: "Find the API key for Mailchimp." Agent's Action: The agent delegates the request to the discovery_agent and rag_agent. The discovery_agent finds a curl command example in the official documentation. The orchestrator then passes this command to the validation_generator_agent to create a standardized validation payload, which is returned to the user.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Discovery via Web Crawling
docs.text: User: "I need to connect to the 'SuperCool API', can you find its credentials?" Agent's Action: The discovery_agent fails to find a curl command but returns URLs to the developer documentation. The orchestrator passes these URLs to the crawler_agent. The crawler_agent fetches the content, and the extractor_agent successfully finds a curl command within a tutorial page. This command is then used by the validation_generator_agent to create the final payload.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Unsupported Authentication
docs.text: User: "Get the API key for 'LegacySystem API'." Agent's Action: The discovery_agent determines that the platform uses an unsupported authentication method. The orchestrator then calls an internal tool to generate a standardized empty payload, indicating that the platform is of type "Other" and cannot be automatically configured.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: This agent helps you send emails through your DotDigital account. It will ask for the necessary details like the recipient's email address, the subject, and the message content. Once it has all the required information, it will send the email for you.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text: • Send Email: This is the primary tool used by the agent. It takes the recipient's email address, the subject line, and the message you provide to send an email using your connected DotDigital account.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few scenarios where this agent can be particularly useful:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Sending a Welcome Email to a New Customer
docs.text: You can use this agent to quickly send a personalized welcome email. Just provide the new customer's email address, a welcoming subject, and the message you want to send.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Distributing a Promotional Offer
docs.text: If you need to send a special offer to a list of subscribers, you can provide the agent with the list of email addresses, the promotional subject, and the offer details. The agent will then handle sending the email to all recipients.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Quick Internal Team Updates
docs.text: For sending a quick update to your team members, you can use the agent to send a plain text email. Simply provide the internal email addresses, a subject for the update, and the message you need to convey.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text:
VIQ is an intelligent assistant specialized in Google Ads analysis and insights for the Vortex IQ platform. Acting as a dedicated business analyst, it translates complex advertising data into clear, actionable business intelligence.

Instead of overwhelming users with raw data tables, the agent focuses on the "so what?"—explaining trends, identifying patterns, and highlighting significant changes in performance. Its goal is to help users understand their ad investment's impact and provide specific, implementable recommendations to optimize strategy, all delivered in a professional yet approachable conversational style.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
The agent utilizes a suite of specialized analytical tools to provide comprehensive insights:

  • Account Structure Analysis: Reviews the fundamental setup of your ad account, including campaign organization, budget allocation, and ad group structure to ensure a healthy foundation for your ads.
  • Performance Reporting: Delivers deep-dive metrics on campaigns, ads, and keywords. It identifies exactly what is driving costs and clicks, helping to pinpoint high-performing and underperforming areas.
  • Segmentation Insights: Breaks down performance data into specific categories such as device type (mobile vs. desktop), time of day, and geographic location, revealing hidden opportunities for optimization.
  • Audience Demographics: Analyzes the characteristics of the people engaging with your ads, specifically focusing on age groups and gender distributions to refine targeting strategies.
  • Conversion Tracking: Focuses on the bottom line by tracking Return on Investment (ROI) and specific conversion actions, showing which parts of your campaigns are generating real business value.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Strategic Budget Optimization
docs.text:
User Goal: The user wants to ensure their monthly budget is yielding the best possible returns.

Agent Action: The agent uses Account Structure and Performance Reporting tools to analyze current spend distribution. It identifies that a specific campaign is consuming 40% of the budget but driving only 10% of conversions.

Outcome: The agent recommends reallocating budget from the low-performing campaign to a high-ROI campaign, potentially increasing overall conversions without increasing total spend.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Demographic Targeting Refinement
docs.text:
User Goal: The user is launching a new product line and wants to know who their current best customers are.

Agent Action: Using Audience Demographics and Segmentation Insights, the agent discovers that "Females aged 25-34" on mobile devices have a 20% higher conversion rate than other segments.

Outcome: The agent suggests adjusting bid modifiers to aggressively target this specific demographic on mobile devices, maximizing efficiency for the new product launch.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Diagnosing Performance Drops
docs.text:
User Goal: The user notices a sudden drop in sales and asks, "Why did my performance go down this week?"

Agent Action: The agent employs Performance Reporting and Conversion Tracking tools to compare this week's data against the previous period. It pinpoints that a top-performing keyword has seen a spike in Cost-Per-Click (CPC) due to increased competition.

Outcome: The agent explains the specific cause of the drop and recommends refining the ad copy or testing new long-tail keywords to bypass the increased competition.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: Google Analytics Insights is your dedicated AI assistant for understanding your website's performance. It specializes in providing clear, actionable insights from your Google Analytics data in a professional and easy-to-understand manner. It can help you understand your website traffic, audience behavior, and performance metrics without needing any technical expertise.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
• Traffic Analysis: Get a clear picture of your website's traffic. Understand how many people are visiting, how engaged they are, which pages are most popular, and what devices they are using.
  • Audience Intelligence: Learn more about your audience. Discover their demographics, where they are located, and their behavior patterns, such as whether they are new or returning visitors.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Understand Website Traffic

docs.title: Scenario 2: Learn About Your Audience

docs.title: Scenario 3: Track Marketing Campaign Success

docs.title: Page Speed and Web Vitals Agent
Agent Overview
docs.text: The PageSpeed and Web Vitals Agent is your personal guide to understanding and enhancing your website's performance and search engine optimization (SEO). Think of it as a helpful assistant that translates complex website data into simple, easy-to-understand advice. The agent's primary role is to check your website's speed and overall user experience, then offer to connect you with specialized agents who can make targeted improvements. It is designed to speak in plain language, avoiding confusing acronyms and technical terms, so you can clearly understand how well your site is performing.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
This agent is equipped with tools to gather insights about your website:

  • Today's Performance Check: This tool provides an immediate snapshot of your website's current performance. It examines key metrics for both desktop and mobile users, giving you a real-time view of your site's speed and how quickly it responds to visitors.
  • Historical Performance Review: This tool looks at your website's performance history over the past few months. It helps you understand trends in your site's user experience, making it easy to spot any ongoing issues that might need attention.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
The agent collaborates with a specialist to help you refine your website's content:

  • VortexIQ Page & Widget Editor: This sub-agent is an expert in editing the content within your website's widgets. It can assist you in making precise changes to improve your site's SEO and ensure your brand's message is clear, consistent, and impactful.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few ways this agent can help you:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Getting a Quick Website Health Check
docs.text:
• You ask: "What is my site's overall Performance Score for today?"
  • The Agent does: The agent uses its "Today's Performance Check" tool to fetch the latest performance scores for both the desktop and mobile versions of your website. It then explains the scores in simple terms—letting you know if they are "Good," "Need Improvement," or "Poor"—and offers a straightforward, non-technical tip to help you improve them.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Understanding Your Website's Past Performance
docs.text:
• You ask: "How quickly did my site's main content load for mobile visitors over the last 90 days?"
  • The Agent does: The agent activates its "Historical Performance Review" tool to analyze loading speed data from the past three months. It will then tell you the average time it took for your main content to load for mobile users and explain whether that speed is ideal or could be improved, suggesting simple fixes like optimizing your images.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Improving Your On-Page Content for Better SEO
docs.text:
• You ask: "My SEO score seems a bit low. Can you help me with that?"
  • The Agent does: After reviewing your site's performance, the agent recognizes that enhancing your on-page content could give your SEO a boost. It will offer, "Now that we've looked at your site's performance, would you like to edit some of the on-page content, like the text in your widgets?" If you agree, it will seamlessly connect you with its specialist sub-agent, the VortexIQ Page & Widget Editor, to guide you through making those improvements.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Seasonal Events Agent acts as your dedicated marketing strategist, specializing in uncovering timely promotional opportunities tailored to your brand. It begins by conducting in-depth research on your business to understand its target audience and market positioning. Using these insights, the agent identifies and presents a curated list of relevant seasonal events, holidays, and awareness days, complete with actionable ideas to help you launch effective marketing campaigns.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text: • Event Discovery: The agent has a powerful capability to find relevant seasonal events. Then, it uses this understanding to find a curated list of events, holidays, and awareness days that offer real business opportunities for you.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The AI Growth Advisor is your master orchestrator for the VortexIQ platform, designed to provide seamless assistance for your Shopify store. Its primary role is to understand your needs and coordinate with a team of specialist agents to deliver precise insights and actions. Whether you want to dive deep into your store's data, uncover marketing opportunities, analyze competitors, or optimize your website's performance, the AI Growth Advisor is here to guide you. It can also analyze specific reports, providing answers based solely on the information within them.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
The AI Growth Advisor uses a variety of tools to help you grow your business. Here’s a non-technical overview of what they can do:

  • KPI Analyst: This tool connects to your Shopify store data to analyze key business metrics. It can help you understand your sales, products, customers, and overall performance, providing insights into your revenue, orders, and more.
  • Seasonal Insights: Discover seasonal marketing events and holidays relevant to your business. This tool helps you find opportunities to promote your products and plan your marketing campaigns around key dates.
  • Competitor Finder: Get a better understanding of your market by identifying and analyzing your competitors. This tool provides business intelligence to help you with your market positioning.
  • PageSpeed Insights: Analyze your website's performance and see how it stacks up against the competition. This tool checks your site speed and Core Web Vitals to help you improve your user experience and SEO.
  • Report Analysis: If you have a specific report you want to analyze, this tool can fetch its content and answer your questions based on the information it contains.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
The AI Growth Advisor works with a team of specialist agents to provide you with the best insights:

  • VortexIQ KPI Analyst for Shopify: This agent specializes in analyzing your Shopify store's data. It can fetch, combine, and interpret key business metrics to give you a clear picture of your store's performance.
  • VortexIQ Seasonal Insights Agent: This agent is your go-to for discovering marketing opportunities. It can identify seasonal events and analyze reports to help you with your marketing strategy.
  • VortexIQ Competitor Finder: This agent helps you with competitor analysis and business intelligence, giving you insights into the competitive landscape.
  • VortexIQ PageSpeed Agent: This agent focuses on your website's performance. It uses PageSpeed Insights and historical data to analyze your site speed and Core Web Vitals.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Understanding a Sales Dip
docs.text: You've noticed a recent dip in sales and want to understand why. You can ask the AI Growth Advisor to analyze your sales data. It will delegate the task to the KPI Analyst, which will look into your revenue, orders, and product performance to identify potential causes for the decline and provide you with actionable insights.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Planning a Summer Marketing Campaign
docs.text: You want to plan a marketing campaign for the upcoming summer season but are not sure where to start. You can ask the AI Growth Advisor for seasonal marketing ideas. It will connect you with the Seasonal Insights Agent, which will provide you with a list of relevant holidays and events for your business, helping you create a targeted and effective campaign.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Improving Your Website's Performance
docs.text: You've identified a key competitor and want to see how your website's performance compares to theirs. You can ask the AI Growth Advisor to benchmark your website. It will use the PageSpeed Agent to analyze your site speed and Core Web Vitals and provide you with a comparison, along with recommendations for improvement.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The AI Growth Advisor is your expert assistant for navigating the VortexIQ platform. It acts as a central coordinator, understanding your business needs and connecting you with the right specialist agent to get the job done. Whether you want to dive into your sales data, find marketing opportunities, check out the competition, or improve your website's speed, the advisor is your single point of contact for powerful business insights. If you have a generated report, the advisor can also answer your questions about it.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text: • Get Report: If you've already generated a report on the platform, this tool allows the advisor to access it and answer your specific questions about its contents.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text:
• Sub-agent 1 name: VortexIQ KPI Analyst - Shopify

    • Subagent Description - Capabilities: This agent is your data expert for Shopify. It can analyze your business metrics, sales data, and performance reports to give you a clear picture of how your store is doing.

  • Sub-agent 2 name: VortexIQ Seasonal Insights Agent

    • Subagent Description - Capabilities: Your go-to source for marketing inspiration. This agent helps you discover seasonal trends, holidays, and events that are relevant to your business, giving you fresh ideas for promotions and campaigns.

  • Sub-agent 3 name: VortexIQ Competitor Finder

    • Subagent Description - Capabilities: Stay ahead of the competition with this agent. It helps you identify and research competing brands, giving you valuable insights into their strategies and market positioning.

  • Sub-agent 4 name: VortexIQ PageSpeed Agent

    • Subagent Description - Capabilities: This agent is your website performance guru. It can analyze your site's speed and provide insights on how to improve the user experience for your customers.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Analyze Sales Performance and Plan a Promotion
docs.text: A user can ask, "How did my top-selling product perform last month?". The AI Growth Advisor will delegate this to the VortexIQ KPI Analyst - Shopify. After getting the sales data, the user could then ask, "What are some upcoming holidays where I can promote this product?". The advisor would then bring in the VortexIQ Seasonal Insights Agent to provide relevant marketing event ideas.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Competitor Research and Website Benchmarking
docs.text: A user might want to know, "Who are my main competitors?". The advisor will use the VortexIQ Competitor Finder. Once a competitor is identified, the user could follow up with, "How does my website speed compare to theirs?". The VortexIQ PageSpeed Agent would then be engaged to provide a comparative performance analysis.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Understanding a Generated Report
docs.text: If a user has a report ready, they can start by saying, "I have a question about my latest product performance report." The AI Growth Advisor will use its Get Report tool to access the report's content and then answer specific questions like, "Which products had the lowest sales last quarter?" based on the information in the report.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Shopify Discount Creator is your helpful assistant for making discount codes for your Shopify store. It's designed to guide you through the process of creating new promotions, asking for all the necessary details to get your discount set up correctly. It can create percentage-based discounts and schedule them to start on a specific date.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
This agent has one primary capability:

  • Create Shopify Discount: This allows the agent to generate new discount codes for your online store. You can tell it the name of the discount, the code you want customers to use, the percentage off, and the date the discount should become active.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenarios
docs.text: Here are a few examples of what the Shopify Discount Creator can help you with:

docs.title: Scenario 1: Holiday Sale Promotion
docs.text: You want to run a holiday sale. You can ask the agent to create a "25% off" discount for your customers. The agent will ask you for a title for the promotion (like "Holiday Special"), a discount code (like "HOLIDAY25"), and when you want the sale to begin.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Flash Sale Coupon
docs.text: If you want to create a quick, limited-time offer, you can ask the agent to generate a flash sale coupon. For example, you could create a "50% off" discount called "FLASH50" to boost sales.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Welcome Discount for New Customers
docs.text: To encourage new shoppers, you can have the agent create a special welcome discount. You could set up a "10% off" coupon with the code "WELCOME10" that new customers can use on their first purchase.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: This agent, named VIQ (Vortex IQ Intelligence), acts as a specialized assistant for managing product images within the Shopify platform. Its main purpose is to help you handle your product visuals in a simple, non-technical way. You can interact with it to find products in your store, view their images, and then perform various management tasks. Whether you want to use AI to edit photos, add new ones, change their order, or replace them, this agent is designed to guide you through the process with clear and friendly communication.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
Here is an overview of what you can do with this agent's tools:

  • Search for Products: Find any product in your store just by typing in a keyword.
  • View Product Images: See all the images associated with a specific product.
  • Browse Images: If a product has a lot of pictures, you can easily look through them page by page.
  • Edit Images with AI: Describe the changes you want to an image (like changing the background), and the agent will use AI to create a new version for you.
  • Add New Images: Easily upload and add a new image to a product's gallery.
  • Replace Images: Swap an existing product image with a new one.
  • Reorder Images: Change the display order of your product photos, including setting a new main image.
  • Undo Image Replacement: If you replace an image and then change your mind, you can easily undo the action to bring the original back.
  • Refresh View: Get the latest, most up-to-date view of your product images directly from your Shopify store.
  • Get Product Link: Instantly get the public, shareable link to a product's page on your live store.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Enhancing a Product Photo with AI
docs.text: You want to make a product photo more appealing by changing its boring background. You can ask the agent to search for your product by its name, select the image you want to edit, and simply ask it to "change the background to a sunny beach." The agent will generate an updated image for you, which you can then save to your product gallery.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Adding a New Image and Making it the Star
docs.text: You have a great new photo for one of your products and want it to be the first thing customers see. You can ask the agent to add the new image to the product's gallery. Once added, you can instruct it to "move this image to the first position," making it the new default display image for that product.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Trying Out a New Image and Reverting
docs.text: You're not sure if a new image is better than the old one. You can use the agent to replace the original image with the new one. After seeing it live on the product page using the "Get Product Link" tool, you decide you prefer the old one. You can simply ask the agent to "undo" or "rollback" the change, and it will instantly restore the original image.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The KPI Agent for Shopify is an expert data analyst designed to help you understand your e-commerce business performance. It answers your questions in plain language, providing deep insights by fetching and interpreting key business metrics from your Shopify store. The agent translates complex data into a clear narrative, offering both an overview of performance and actionable recommendations to help you grow your business.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
The agent has access to tools that allow it to retrieve a wide range of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) from your store. This includes information about:

  • Sales & Orders: Total sales amount, number of orders, average order value.
  • Discounts: How many orders used a discount and the total discount amount.
  • Shipping: Total shipping costs and the number of orders with shipping fees.
  • Customers: New customer registrations and the number of customers who have placed orders.
  • Refunds & Failures: Data on fully or partially refunded orders, as well as orders that failed during checkout.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent operates as a single, specialized data analyst and does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Get a high-level business summary
docs.text:
• You ask: "How is my business doing overall?"
  • The agent answers: By fetching your total sales, number of orders, and new customer sign-ups. It then provides a summary of your revenue, order volume, and customer growth, along with recommendations on how to improve.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Gauge customer satisfaction
docs.text:
• You ask: "Are my customers happy with their purchases?"
  • The agent answers: By analyzing your refund data. It compares the number of refunded orders to your total orders to calculate a satisfaction rate and suggests ways to address potential product or service issues if refund rates are high.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Evaluate the impact of your promotions
docs.text:
• You ask: "Are my discounts worth it?"
  • The agent answers: By analyzing how discounts contribute to your revenue. It weighs the total amount of discounts used against your total sales, helping you understand the effectiveness of your promotional campaigns and whether they are driving sufficient sales.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: The Nerve Centre agent is designed to help you with your Shopify store. It focuses on improving your store's performance by managing and optimizing large banner images. When an image is optimized to load faster, this agent will notify you, show you a preview on a test site, and with your approval, move it to your live production store. It aims to make your website faster and more efficient.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text: • Banner Image Migration: This tool automates the process of updating your Shopify store's main banner image. It takes an optimized, faster-loading image and replaces the old one on your homepage, helping to improve your site's performance.

docs.title: Sub-agents
docs.text: This agent does not have any sub-agents.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Improving Page Load Speed
docs.text: An agent has identified a large banner image on your Shopify store that is slowing down your page load time. It optimizes the image and moves it to a staging site. The Nerve Centre Agent then alerts you about the optimized image, providing details on the size reduction and a link to the staging site to review the changes. You can then approve the change, and the agent will automatically update your production site with the new, faster-loading banner.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Approving Changes from Staging to Production
docs.text: You receive a notification from the Nerve Centre Agent that an optimized banner is ready for review on a staging site. After checking the staging site and confirming that you are happy with the improved performance and appearance, you can simply tell the agent to proceed. The agent will then migrate the optimized banner to your live production site, ensuring a seamless update for your customers.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Rolling Back Unsatisfactory Changes
docs.text: After the optimized banner has been moved to the production site, you notice an issue or are not satisfied with the new look. You can inform the Nerve Centre Agent, which gives you the option to roll back the changes. With your confirmation, the agent can revert the banner to its previous version, restoring your store's earlier appearance.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is your expert AI assistant for Shopify, specializing in optimizing your store's pages for better search engine performance. It simplifies the process of improving your page's SEO by finding the best keywords, rewriting content, and updating your Shopify store, all while maintaining your brand's unique voice.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
• Get Brand Guardrails: Fetches your brand's guidelines to ensure all content matches your established tone and style.
  • Set Active Brand Profile: Allows you to select a specific brand profile for content generation.
  • Get All Shopify Pages: Retrieves a list of all pages from your Shopify store.
  • Get Shopify Page SEO: Gathers the current SEO details of a specific page.
  • Update Shopify Page SEO: Updates a page's SEO content with new, optimized text.
  • Search Shopify Page by Fields: Searches for pages in your store based on keywords.

docs.title: Sub-agent 1: Content Creation Workflow
docs.text: • Description: This agent is a two-step workflow that first researches trending keywords and then writes compelling, SEO-friendly content. It ensures your page's title and description are optimized to attract more customers.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Improve a Specific Page's SEO
docs.text: • You can ask VIQ to find a specific page in your Shopify store. VIQ will then analyze its current SEO and suggest improvements. With your approval, it will rewrite the SEO title and meta description to be more effective and update the page for you.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Find and Optimize Underperforming Pages
docs.text: • If you're unsure where to start, you can ask VIQ to find all pages related to a certain topic (e.g., "summer collection"). From there, you can select a page to optimize, and VIQ will enhance its SEO to improve its visibility in search results.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Ensure Brand Consistency Across All Pages
docs.text: • Before making any changes, VIQ can retrieve your brand's guidelines. This ensures that all SEO enhancements—from keyword choice to writing style—are perfectly aligned with your brand's voice, maintaining a consistent customer experience.

docs.title: Agent Overview
docs.text: VIQ is your expert SEO assistant for Shopify. It is designed to help you manage your product optimization workflow with ease. VIQ can help you find products that need SEO attention, generate enhanced SEO content, and update your products with the new content. It is professional, efficient, and relentlessly helpful.

docs.title: Agent Tools
docs.text:
• Get Product Count: Find out the total number of products in your Shopify store.
  • Search Products by Keyword: Easily find specific products you want to optimize by searching for them with a keyword.
  • Fetch Product Details: Get all the important details for a specific product to help you with your optimization efforts.
  • Update Product: Once you're happy with the new SEO content, you can use this tool to update the product in your store.
  • Find Products with Empty SEO Fields: Proactively find products that are missing important SEO information so you can fix them.
  • Migrate Product to Staging: Move a product to a staging environment to test out your SEO changes before making them live.
  • Migrate Product to Production: Once you're happy with your changes, you can move the product from the staging environment to your live store.
  • Check Migration Status: Check the status of a product migration to see if it has been successfully moved.
  • Rollback Product: If you're not happy with the changes you've made, you can easily roll back the product to a previous version.
  • Check Rollback Status: Check the status of a rollback to see if the product has been successfully reverted.

docs.title: Sub-agent 1: Content Creation Workflow
docs.text: • Sub-agent Description - Capabilities: This sub-agent is a specialist in creating high-quality SEO content for your products. It can research relevant keywords and use them to write compelling product titles and descriptions that will help you rank higher in search results.

docs.title: Scenario 1: Optimizing a product's SEO
docs.text: You can provide VIQ with a product SKU, and it will fetch the product's details and generate enhanced SEO content for it. You can then review the new content and, if you're happy with it, VIQ will update the product in your store.

docs.title: Scenario 2: Finding and fixing products with missing SEO information
docs.text: VIQ can scan your store and find products that are missing important SEO information, such as meta descriptions or image alt text. It will then help you fix these issues so you can improve your store's SEO.

docs.title: Scenario 3: Testing out SEO changes before making them live
docs.text: If you want to test out some new SEO strategies without affecting your live store, you can use VIQ to migrate a product to a staging environment. You can then make your changes and see how they affect the product's SEO before pushing them to your live store.

docs.text:

docs.title: 2. Store and Application log section
docs.text:

Search - allows you to search for entries in the change log.

Note

the entered text is searched for in the columns ID, Event and Status.

docs.title: 3a. “Change Logs” sub-tab
docs.text:
Clicking on the “Change Logs” sub-tab displays data grid containing the following:

  • ID - change log unique identifier
  • Event - description of change log event
  • Status - shows change log status of Success/Failure
  • Date & Time - date & time of the change log entry
  • View button - This button is displayed only for ‘Failure’ status. Clicking this button will display a popup window with the message “We encountered an issue while processing your request due to a data mapping error with the BigCommerce API. Would you like our support team to investigate this and get back to you?”.

Clicking on the ‘Yes’ button will send an email to the support team (helpdesk@vortexiq.ai) for troubleshooting purpose.

docs.title: 3b. “Webhook Logs” sub-tab
docs.text:
Clicking on the “Webhook Logs” sub-tab displays data grid containing the following:

  • Log ID - change log unique identifier
  • Entity Data entity
  • EntityID - Data entity unique identifier
  • Service - Type of webhook
  • Error Message - Response received from the BigCommerce API
  • Date & Time - Date & time of the webhook log entry
  • View button Clicking on this button displays the API response received from the BigCommerce API

docs.title: Understanding Restore Center
docs.text: This section enables users to search for specific data from their store or channels, view various versions of that data, and restore it to a chosen version. The restore functionality is essential for businesses needing to recover from issues such as data corruption, erroneous updates, or accidental deletions.

docs.title: 1. Section title
docs.text: Shows the section title of the Vortex Backup app, a brief outline of the sections functionality and navigation tabs to click such as Dashboard, Restore Center, Change Logs & Settings.

docs.title: 2. Filters section
docs.text: You can use the following filter options:

docs.title: Textbox
docs.text:
specify a text word (e.g., infinity) and click the search icon or press enter key to obtain the results.

Note

The entered text is searched for in all the fields of all the products, not just Name and SKU.

docs.title: Date picker
docs.text:
Pick your date range by i) All Time ii) 12 months iii) 30 days iv) 7 days v) Today

You can also use the ‘Select Dates’ option to filter results by a specific date range. First, choose the start and end dates, then click the ‘Apply’ button. After that, click the ‘Submit’ button to confirm your selection and view the filtered results.

docs.title: Backup Entity (Content Type) Filter
docs.text: You can also filter by Content Type to view tracked versions for a specific type. Please note that only one content type can be selected at a time. After selecting the desired type, click the ‘Apply’ button to display the filtered results.

docs.title: 3. Snapshot of Change History section
docs.text:
Depending on the selected data entity type, the corresponding grid columns will be displayed. For example, if "Products" is selected, the grid columns will appear as follows:

  • ID Displays BigCommerce’s Product Id of the product
  • Name Displays Product name
  • SKU Displays Product SKU (Stock Keeping Unit)
  • Price Displays price at which the product was listed at the time of the backup.
  • Date Modified - displays the date of the modification done to the product for the particular version.
  • Date Created displays the date on which the first tracking record for your product was created.
  • Version Displays the version number of the tracked changes made to the product. Each version represents a new backup instance or update of the data entry, helping users track how many changes have occurred to the specific product or data entity since its initial creation.
  • Preview button - Under the Actions column, clicking this button will display the product information for both the current version (defaulting to the 'Summary' view) and the selected version side by side for comparison. After reviewing the differences, you can click the “Restore to this version” button to revert the product data to the selected version.

Clicking on 'Source code' will display the product data in JSON format, making it easier to compare different versions.

The version dropdown displays the tracked versions available for the product, allowing you to select any one to restore the data.

docs.text:
This shows the section title, section overview, backup entities and statuses, highlighting the scope of data backed up and their most recent backup times. This helps the user track the status of key business data entities in real-time

The data entities are grouped into 3 tab sections which you can click as applicable.

docs.title: Catalogue Data

This shows the store catalogue backup data that includes:

  • Products

docs.title: Customer Data

docs.title: 3. Grid Information
docs.text:
Each grid item displays as follows:

  • Entity shows the name of the data backup entity (e.g., Products)
  • Backup Type - shows the backup type status of Realtime or Manual
  • Status - allows you to enable or disable real-time backup sync
  • Date & Time - shows the date & time of the last sync status
  • Action displays ‘Backup’ button for ‘Manual' Backup type only

If you click the status and change it to Disabled, then the app stops listening to any webhook changes.

Clicking on ‘Backup’ , triggers the ‘Backup Now’ popup so you can click ‘Confirm’ the backup.

This will initiate full backup of the data and enable the realtime backup functionality again.

Important

Please ensure to take full backup manually before any major changes by clicking on ‘Backup’ button, for the following data entities that do not have webhooks i.e., no realtime backup functionality, but ‘Manual' backup type.

a) Brands

b) Promotions

c) Blog Posts

d) Coupons

e) Gift Certificates

f) 301 Redirects

docs.title: 2. Store and backup/sync info
docs.text:
This shows the following information:

  • Store Name - displays the name of your BigCommerce store
  • Store Identifier - displays the store hash value of your BigCommerce store
  • App Data Backup From - The date and time of the oldest order in the backup
  • Most Recent Change Received - This is the date and time of the most recent data change recorded on the system through real-time change tracking.
  • Sync Status - Indicates whether real-time synchronization is currently Active or Paused for all the BigCommerce webhook-based data elements the app is subscribed to. These are the entities the app monitors via webhooks to detect changes and perform backups accordingly.

Users can disable real-time (live) sync via the Settings tab, which is useful in scenarios where data synchronization needs to be temporarily paused.

The Sync Status will be displayed as:

  • Active – if at least one entity is enabled
  • Paused – only when all entities are disabled

docs.text:
